Some of her children are still living with them and they are: Analiza - 23 years old, a high school graduate; Hustle Joy - 20 years old; Sunshine - 18 years old, a high school graduate; Feric Art - 16 years old; and Princes - 12 years old who is now in her second year high school.

Lolita hopes that she will be able to continue to support her youngest daughter in her schooling.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou L., 29, is married with a three-year-old child. To make a living, she has been in the city to work as a garment factory worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is involved in the agriculture sector, and he is also a construction worker in his province, earning an income of US $5 per day. Their living standard is improved since they have had these businesses. Therefore, Eng is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport his rice production to sell. By doing so, she hopes her husband will be able to generate more income to raise a good standard of living for the family.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng C., 30, is married with two school-aged children. She resides with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she has a business weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of $3 per day in revenue. Also, with her available time from weaving, she is involved in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer to earn extra income. Her husband helps her with her craft and raises pigs for resale, earning an income of $3 per day. This couple is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase more silk to expand the craft business. C. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plan of investment to expand her business is successful.

loans.use: To buy silk to expand the business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta G., owns and manages a small corn farm in her village. She is 38 years old and has been married for 12 years. She has three children. Her eldest child is 10 years old. She has been doing her best to prosper in her her livelihood in order to help pay the tuition, books and other school fees. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use her loan to buy all the farming necessities to grow her crops.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita G. is 23 years old, living in Barangay Mozzozzin Norte, Sta. Maria Isabela. She is happily married and blessed with a child named Angelica Mae, who is 5 years old and in kindergarten in their village. Clarita is engaged in the retail of rice. Her husband is a local farmer and also a Barangay Councilor in their village. Since her husband does not have regular work, she started her own business as another source of income. Together they are helping one another to provide for their basic needs. Clarita wants to improve her business; thus she is asking to borrow a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She plans to buy several sacks of rice and other commodities that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Tusobola Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Teopista K. is 40 years old and is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is married and cares for her three children and four orphans.

Teopista has been running a retail shop operation for ten years and generates 70,000 UGX per week from the business. Right now, her capital levels are low and she would like to use the loan amount of 300,000 UGX to boost business and increase levels of inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Gaang near Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Elena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elena raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for daily needs and to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbacke Modou, célibataire âgé de 23 ans est boutiquier à Bambey. C’est après son apprentissage à l’école coranique qu’il a embrassé ce secteur. Ainsi, à la recherche d’une certaine indépendance et à défaut de qualification professionnelle, Monsieur Modou Mbacke décida d’ouvrir une boutique dans son quartier. Cependant, Monsieur Mbacke demande un crédit de 150 000 frs CFA pour réapprovisionner  sa boutique. Il compte acheter avec le prêt du riz, de l’huile et du sucre qui sont des marchandises très prisées par la communauté. Avec cette première demande de crédit, Monsieur Modou Mbacké espère accroitre ses bénéfices afin d’être bien considérer dans sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Mbacké, aged 23, is single and a storekeeper in Bambey. He launched his business after having studied at the Islamic school. In his quest for some independence and since he mastered no craft, he decided to open a convenience store in his neighborhood. He applies now for a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to resupply his store. He will buy rice, oil and sugar, which are products in high demand in the local community. This is Mr. Mbacké’s first loan and he hopes that it will enable him to increase his earnings and be well regarded in his family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice P. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages, beer, and soda, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Joice is 33 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 6 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Confines Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco comunal “Confines del Sur” son de la ciudad de Angol, ubicada a 2 horas hacia el sur de Temuco, en la Región de la Araucanía. Temuco se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativa. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existentes en nuestro país.
Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de provisiones y verduras en ferias, a atender bazares, librerías y  peluquerías. 
Noemí, es la presidenta de este BC. En la foto es la única mujer rubia de la 1º fila. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil y ropa interior, puerta a puerta y confecciona recuerdos para eventos tales como graduaciones, bautizos y matrimonios. 
Noemí invertirá este préstamo en ropa para vender. Con ella vive su hija menor de 7 años , la cual es su gran motivación para trabajar. Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en su propia casa, para de esta manera alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Noemí Fondo Esperanza ha significado una oportunidad y herramientas para surgir.
texts.en:
The members of the "Confines del Sur" communal bank are from Angol, which is two hours south of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Temuco is 670 kilometers south of Santiago, Chile's capital, and it has several lakeside resorts and very showy flora and fauna. It's worth noting that this area is home to 50% of Mapuche, an indigenous people of Chile. Most of the members sell new and used clothing. Some sell groceries and vegetables in the markets, some tend to sales stalls, bookstores, barbershops. Noemí is the president of the communal bank. In the photo, she is the only blonde in the first row. She sells underwear and young adult clothing door-to-door; she also makes souvenirs for events like graduations, baptisms and weddings. Noemí will use the funds to buy clothing to sell. Her 7-year-old daughter, who is the motivating force in her life, lives with her. Her dream is to have an established store in her home so that she can reach a better quality of life. For Noemí, Fondo Esperanza has meant an opportunity and the tools to surge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is from the village of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Susan is married and has 8 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Susan sells clothing and shoe products to the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Susan joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting her first loan from GDMPC, for 10000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elba Luz

texts.es: Elba Luz C. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, una niña de 9 años la cual se dedica a estudiar, una bebé de 15 meses de edad, y su abuela de 68 años de edad, quien le ayuda con el cuido de sus hijas y los quehaceres del hogar. Elba se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, las cuales son un platillo típico hecho a base de plátano, con el cual se forma una masa y se hace una bolita que se rellena ya sea de leche o de frijoles y luego se fríe y al servirlas se les agrega azúcar. Las empanadas son hechas en su casa, proceso en el cual su abuela le ayuda, ya que hacen una cantidad bastante razonable, las cuales comercializa en una escuela del lugar con todos los jóvenes de educación media. Así mismo las vende en su casa con ayuda de su abuela y Elba se encarga de venderlas a parte de la escuela de forma ambulante por colonias y cantones. Elba se esfuerza mucho por vender todo su producto cada día, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, así mismo porque ella es la única que sostiene a su familia y se encarga de todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de plátanos, leche, frijoles, azúcar  y aceite, lo cual es la materia prima de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elba Luz C. M. is 28, and she lives in the Morazán department. She lives with her two children. She has a nine year old daughter who goes to school and a 15 month old baby. She also lives with her 68 year old grandmother who helps her take care of her daughters and do the household chores. Elba makes empanadas. This is a typical dish made with a banana base, which is formed into dough. It is shaped into a small ball and has a milk or bean filling. Then it is fried and served with sugar on top. The empanadas are made in her house. Her grandmother helps with the process because they make a fair amount. She sells them to middle school students at a school in her area. She also sells them at home with help from her grandmother. Elba is in charge of selling them away from the school as a traveling vendor in neighborhoods and cantons. Elba puts forth a lot of effort to sell all of her product everyday because it is the only source of income that she has. She is the only one supporting her family and paying all of the household expenses. That is the reason she is asking for Integral for a loan. With the loan she will be able to buy a larger quantity of bananas, milk, beans, sugar, and oil. These are the raw materials of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, milk, beans, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 26 años de edad, que trabajan de manera independiente. La señora tiene un negocio de compra-venta de frutas y verduras. Cabe señalarse, ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 14 años, ella empezó en este negocio comprando pequeñas cosechas de limones, las cuales en ese tiempo vendía en el M. con su mama. Luego decide iniciar con su propio negocio. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de naranjas de ½ manzana, las cuales ya les hace falta solamente unos dos meses para empezar a sacar cosecha. Su tiempo de sacar cosecha es de aproximadamente 4 meses y medio. Su sueño siempre ha sido contar con suficiente capital propio para no depender de los créditos para poder sufragar los gastos, sin embargo no se queja de los beneficios del financiamiento ya que le ha permitido diversificar sus inventarios.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who are 22 and 26 years old. They work independently. She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. It is worth noting that she started this business 14 years ago. She began by buying small harvests of lemons, which at that time she sold in her mother's market. Later she decided to start her own business. At present, she is asking for a loan from Fundación León 2000 to be invested in purchasing oranges from a 3,500 sq. meter lot. These will be ready to start harvesting in about two months. The harvesting time is about 4 and a half months long. Her dream has always been to have enough of her own capital to not depend on loans to be able to pay for expenses. Nevertheless, she is not complaining about the benefits of financing since it has allowed her to diversify her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Ayllu que significa Bella Familia en quechua.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Norma viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales, papa que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho e Ica.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Norma son mejorar su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the communal bank "Sumaq Ayllu," which means "Beautiful Family" in Quechua. Norma is 34, and lives with a partner and 3 children. She travels to the different markets where she buys groceries, and from these markets she buys cereals and potatoes that she sells in the markets of the cities of Ayacucho and Ica. Norma needs a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of potatoes. Norma dreams of improving her house and of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase potatoes

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en:
Fatimon sells ice fish buy supplying her customers from one shop to another. She started the business 30 years ago. She likes the nature of her business and she wants more growth in her business and her profit. She is asking for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more ice fish to sell to her numerous costumers.

Fatimon is 50 years old, married with 3 children and they are age 20, 14 and 10 years old. Her husband sells building materials and both lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: T. Yvette est née en 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FAGBOHOUN Mathieu, un tailleur, Yvette est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Kowégbo à Cotonou. Yvette vit dans ce quartier depuis dix sept ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Yvette n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de douze ans que Yvette mène comme activité la vente de condiments (tomate fraîche, oignons, poissons fumés, piments, épices, etc.) et divers autres produits dans son quartier à Kowégbo. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Yvette s'approvisionne. Yvette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Yvette ambitionne développer davantage son activité et accroître sa part de marché ; raison pour laquelle Yvette sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
T. Yvette was born in 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to FAGBOHOUN Mathieu, a tailor, she is married and the mother of four children, who have all attended school.  Yvette has been living with her husband and children in the Kowégbo district for 17 years.  Together, the couple ensure that their various family expenses are covered.  Yvette has never attended school.  For almost a dozen years, she has been running a business selling condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, smoked fish, chili peppers, spices, etc.) and a variety of other goods in her district of Kowégbo.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already benefited from three loans, which were all repaid.  She has the ambition to develop her businesses and to grow her market share.  These are the reasons why she is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, smoked fish, chili peppers, spices) and vegetables.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha T., 52, is from the town of Fugu Jones. She is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Editha is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sarun Seb Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan belongs to eleven people who live in Kampong Chamlang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarun S. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each group member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sarun S. was born in 1940. Now she owns a general store at her home where she earns money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her business, Mrs. Sarun S. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. She is a widow who lives with two other people in her household.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en: Gullu D. has been engaged in farming for the last two years. She has her own garden where she raises seasonal vegetables and fruits. She sells her product to the local bazaar traders and her monthly income is about 160 AZN. She applied for 1000 AZN in order to expand her business. Gullu applied for this loan because she needs to increase her profit. She has a son, whom she raises alone as she is widow.

loans.use: To increase her profit via purchasing new sorts of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, Fuerza Divina 1 & 7 (Divine Force). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and a son. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a better life. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being with her little son.

Maribel is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two-and-a-half years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying household products. She will use the profits to buy school supplies and she is dreaming of building her house.
 
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to have a better life with more opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy household products to sell

loans.name: Agnes Bosibori

texts.en:
Agnes Bosibori M. is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of two children; one is 5 years old and the other is 5 months old. She has a small shop that she has been running for the last four years on a busy street in Narok Town.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her second loan. She is planning to increase her shop stock by buying more soft drinks, especially during this sunny season as she knows demand for them will be high. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. 

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house and be running the shop at her own premises.
 
Agnes also believes she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To increase her shop stock by buying more soft drinks

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. sells foodstuffs at Takoradi. She is married to a laborer and they live together with their three children. Sarah has received senior high school education. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Sarah’s loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maame Efua

texts.en: Maame Efua K. sells charcoal and firewood in Elmina. She is married and has four children. She has attained a junior high school level of education. Her husband is a security man. Maame uses her income to help her husband take care of the children. Maame will use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Maame plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rio De Oro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Río D. Oro inicia su quinto ciclo con 18 socias.
Haydee es tesorera D. su Banco Comunal Por primera vez, llego a ser socia por invitación D. sus amigas para ahorrar porque en casa no se pueD..
Haydee tiene 37, es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 9 y 4 años, Haydee brinda servicios D. bordado en correas, bolsas para una empresa, además trabaja realizando limpieza en una oficina por las mañanas. El esposo D. Haydee es albañil y realiza trabajos por contratos.
Haydee solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles para L. compra D. herramientas D. albañilería.
Haydee sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Río D. Oro” (River of Gold) is starting its fifth loan cycle with 18 members.

Haydee is serving for the first time as the Communal Bank treasurer. She became a member after being invited by her friends because she wanted to save but was not able to do so at home. Haydee is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 9 and 4). She offers her services to a company by producing embroidered belts and purses. Haydee also has a morning job in which she cleans an office. Her husband is a mason and works on contract jobs.

She is requesting a loan of 300 PEN to buy masonry tools. Haydee dreams of opening a grocery store and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase masonry tools

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 37 ans, marie et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 21 ans,il commence ce commerce en 2002 quand il perd son travail lors de la faillite de lusine ou il travaillait.

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.
En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant , des sanitaires,des robinets,des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des pointes de toute taille..
A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
Michel is a young 37 year old man, he is married and the father of three children between the ages of 5, and 21 years old. He started his business in2002 when he lost his job when the factory he worked for went bankrupt. In order to overcome this and take care of his family's needs, he launched his hardware business. 

He has several sales strategies and his clients are entrepreneurs and public servants who are trained to build houses. On average, he sells between 5,000 and 50,000 francs of goods. With this loan he will be able to increase his stock; he intends to purchase toilets, faucets, switches, fuses and nails of all sizes. In the future he intends to start a wholesale business and, with his savings, he will open a large store. He will travel to Cameroon, Nigeria and Dubai to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: Achat des interrupteurs, des fusibles

loans.name: Lay Kelly

texts.es:
Lay P. de 22 años es una joven comerciante de productos de belleza y mercancía variada a través de  catálogos de productos de una importante empresa a la que está vinculada en su calidad de comerciante; Lay  es muy organizada y quiere crecer como persona y mejorar sus condiciones de negocio día a día, por eso  en la actualidad solicita un credikiva para  invertirlo en perfumería  masculina, femenina, utensilios para el hogar y ropa interior que tiene encargado por clientes reales y potenciales, con los que aspira a aumentar sus utilidades en un 25% sobre este nuevo capital de trabajo,  financiado a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo .
Cuando Lay aun tenia 17 años,   inició su negocio  por alternativa propia, esto ocurrió en  el año 2005, cuando buscaba la  forma de apoyar a sus padres y ser autosuficiente;  con sus ingresos  ha podido adelantar algunos cursos de capacitación que le ha ayudado mucho.
  Ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a través de un primer crédito hace un año,  y con su financiamiento ha logrado responder oportunamente a sus clientes y ganarle dinero a un nuevo capital, con el que antes no contaba; también con esta organización ha logrado capacitarse y ahora es mas austera en el gasto, así como disciplinada en el control de su inversión y de su cartera.
En el futuro sueña con tener una empresa dedicada al comercio con sus propios catálogos, su mayor desafío ocurrió cuando empezó otorgándole crédito de sus productos a clientes que sin ninguna consideración se fueron y no le pagaron, de esta experiencia le resultó importante porque ahora revisa bien a quien ofrecerle sus productos a crédito.
texts.en:
Lay P., who is 22 years old, is a young dealer of beauty products and various merchandise through the product catalogs of an important business to which she is tied in her capacity as a dealer. Lay is very organized and wants to grow as a person and improve her business conditions day by day. For this reason she is now soliciting a Kiva loan to invest in perfume for men and women, utensils for the home, and underwear that has been ordered by actual and potential customers. With these products she aspires to increase her profits by 25% through this new working capital financed through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.

When Lay was still 17 years old, she began her business by her own choice. This was in the year 2005, when she was looking for a way to support her parents and be self-sufficient. With her income, she has been able to advance through some training courses that have helped her a lot.

She came in to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation through her first loan a year ago, and with her financing she has succeeded in responding to her customers in a timely manner and earning money for new capital, which she did not have before. With this organization (the Foundation), she has also succeeded in getting training, and now she is more austere in her spending as well as disciplined in the control of her investments and her assets.

In the future she dreams of having a business dedicated to sales through her own catalogs. Her greatest challenge occurred when she began to grant credit on her products to customers who, without any consideration, left and did not pay her. This experience turned out to be important for her because now she reviews carefully to whom she offers her products on credit.

loans.use: Invest in perfume for men and women, household utensils, and underwear ordered by actual and potential customers.

loans.name: Cecilia Paulina

texts.es:
Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 05 hijos (03 dependientes). La señora tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.

Cecilia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años, nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de quesos, chalina y artefactos.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá  en la mercadería de su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital para su negocio y tener una casa en Puerto Mazuco. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the community bank “Punta Sahuacasi”, located in the district of Azángaro, province of Azángaro, department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children (3 of them are still dependants). Mrs. Cecilia completed her elementary school.

Cecilia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years; she tells us that her first loan was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles which she used to increase the working capital for her business of selling cheeses, scarves and other products.

She is now requesting a new loan for S/. 1000 Nuevos Soles which she will invest in merchandise for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more working capital for her business and to have a house in Puerto Mazuco. What she likes the most about her community bank are the meetings and talks.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maame Abina

texts.en:
Maame Abina A. smokes and as well fries fish for sale at Elmina. Maame is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a cleaner. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education to her children from her additional profit.

At the time of visit, she was yet to go to the seashore to purchase the fish. She is displaying the things she will be using for the fish when she is ready.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy M. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has five children all of them in school.  Prossy has had a business selling shoes for 10 years. To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits to buy food and, in the future, expand her business.

loans.use: buy more shoes.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim P., 50, is requesting a loan of USD 400 to repair her house. P. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 4 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 23 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair house

loans.name: El Rinconcito (Comercio) Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama el "El RINCONCITO" (COMERCIO), es de la comunidad de Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso, resalto que en está comunidad se diferencia de otras porqué hay mucho profesionista, la mayoria son Licenciados y Maestros, y hay mucha gente preparandose en una carrera y estudiantes en general.

El grupo es de 4 integrantes es un grupo pequeño, antes habia mas gente en el grupo pero desidieron descansar un tiempo para despues seguir con el grupo, los integrantes son todos vecinos y se conocen desde hace años, comentan que el grupo se llama EL RINCONCITO porqué así se le conoce el lugar donde viven los vecinos, es porqué se encuentran en un rincon de la comunidad, de los 4 integrantes 2 son mujeres y 2 son hombres. Los nombres son los siguientes:

1.-Raymunda M. M., la señora es comerciante, tiene 55 años de edad.

2.-Ebelia C. Gómez, 50 años de edad

3.-German R. R., 49 años de edad

4.-Margarito Gónzalez T., 45 años de edad.

Los 4 integrantes son comerciantes, se dedican a la jarceria, todo lo referente al plastico, usan puestos ambulantes para cargar la mercancía y salen a vender los dias de plaza en cualquier parte.

La señora Raymunda M. es tesorera del grupo, tiene 55 años de edad, su negocio es un puesto ambulante de algunas vandejas, cremas, rastrillos, zacate de baño etc, los viernes y los domingos, entre semana atiende una tienda general de abarrotes, para lo que solicito su prestamo es para llenar de nuevo la tienda de mercancía, y de está manera saca dinero de ambos lados, se apoya de sus dos negocios.
Uno de los desafios de doña Raymunda son las ventas, no son lo que espera, hay dias muy bajos y la desespera demasiado, lo poco que se gana es para volver a invertir y seguir trabajando
La familia de doña Raymunda es algo grande, fueron 6 hijos los que tubo, 5 mujeres y 1 hombre, un hijo ya es casado, los otros trabajan, pero solo un hijo depende de ella, se encuentra estudiando y quiere terminar los estudios, por eso doña Raymunda lo sigue apoyando y parte de las ganancias son para sus pasejes a la escuela y para lo que le pidan.
Una de las metas es que su negocio le pueda seguir dando aunque sea poquito para que su hijo termine la escuela y no se quede a medias, doña Raymunda lleva 40 años de casada, vive con su esposo, es casa propia y su esposo solo se dedica al campo y ayudarla en la tienda cuando ella no esta.
texts.en:
This group is called "EL RINCONCITO" (The Little Corner).  It is located in the community of Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso.  This community is noted as being different from others because a lot of its residents are professionals.  Most people have university degrees and are teachers.  There are a lot of university students and students in general.

This group has 4 members.  It is a small group.  There used to be more people in the group but they decided to take a break for a while and then continue with the group later.  The members are all neighbors who have known each other for years.  They say that the group is called EL RINCONCITO (The Little Corner) because that is what the area they live in is known as because they live in a corner of their community.  Of the group's 4 members, 2 are women and 2 are men.  Their names are as follows:

1.-Raymunda M. M..  Raymunda is 55 years old and a saleswoman.

2.-Ebelia C. Gómez, 50 years old.

3.-German R. R., 49 years old.

4.-Margarito Gónzalez T., 45 years old.

The four members of this group are salespeople.  They sell cleaning supplies and plastic products.  They use carts which they load with merchandise and then go out to sell in different places on market days.

Raymunda M. is the group's treasurer.  She is 55 years old and she works as an itinerant street vendor, selling trays, creams, razors, bath sponges, etc.  She makes her sales on Fridays and Sundays.  During the week she serves in her grocery store.  She is requesting her loan to restock her store with merchandise and, in this way, make money from both businesses.

One of Raymunda's challenges is her sales.  They are not as good as she would hope for.  There are some days when she sells very little and she becomes exasperated.  However, she reinvests the little that she earns in her business and continues working.

Raymunda's family is quite large.  She has six children: five daughters and one son.  One of her children is married.  The others work.  Only one of her children is still dependent as he is studying and would like to finish his studies.  For this reason, Raymunda continues supporting him and part of her profits go towards paying for his journeys to school and whatever else he needs.

One of Raymunda's goals is to keep her business going, even though it isn't much, so that her son can finish school and not have to leave his studies half finished.  Raymunda has been married for 40 years.  She lives with her husband in her own home and her husband works in the fields and helps her with the store when she isn't there.

loans.use: To pay suppliers of soft drinks, chips, cookies and candy

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta B. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food & toothpaste in the local community. She also buys and sells coconut wine or tuba. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk food. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk food.

loans.name: Mary Nataana

texts.en:
Mary Nataana E. T. is 44 years old. She is married and is a mother of four school-going children.  Mary is a farmer and has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Mary learned about KADET LTD from other women in her area of residence who are already registered with KADET. This will be her third loan, which she is planning to spend to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Mary's dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses, and to ensure that her children live a better life.  She is a punctilious woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng R. is 52 years old.  She is from the province of Siem Reap.  She sells fish that she gets from her husband's fishing. She also buys fish in bulk from other fishermen and brings them to sell at the market. 

Seng R. is a good mother, blessed with five children --  two of them are single and three are married. One of her children works as a fish trader in and around the community, earning a revenue of around $3 each day. 

Seng R. will use her loan to dig a pond to raise small fish. This will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide them more financial stability.

loans.use: To dig pond to raise fish

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: For the past 15 years Hannah N. has been selling provisions, vegetables and food items such as garden eggs, tomatoes, peppers, near Nkroful at Takoradi. Hannah has been educated up to the senior high level.  She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. As a supportive wife, she makes sure that there is always food in the home. Her loan will increase capital to expand her business. Hannah anticipates using the new profit to further her children’s education, since education now is the key to success.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Ellie

texts.en:
Ellie C. is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ellie sells bananas, coconuts and charcoal in the local community. Ellie has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ellie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ellie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as charcoal and bananas. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ellie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as charcoal and bananas

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and married. He has two children. He sells scrap metals and used plastic containers for recycling. He has been running the business for five years.  

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to John's business because he has managed to use his previous loan to open an outlet of his business.  With his income, he is able to pay his employee and to provide for his family. He hopes to have a stable business in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy scrap metals, plastic containers and for personal use.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals, plastic containers and for personal use.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 30 years old and lives in the area of Congo Town. A freshman student at the university and still single, she has to take care of her twelve-year-old child.

Vivian has not given up and she operates her own little restaurant where she sells Liberian dishes and drinks. Vivian is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks.

Vivian hopes to improve her child's education and educate herself as well.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks.

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Hannah Wanjiru is 66 years old and married to N. who contributes to the family income. She has been running her retail shop for a period of about three years with an income of approximately 15,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan cycle from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. She hopes to own an estate and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Liz Erika

texts.es:
La Sra. Liz Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años  y tiene tres  hijos varones que estudian  en el nivel inicial y primario.  

La idea del negocio que actualmente desarrolla  nace en coordinación con su pareja quien tiene un taller de mecánica de motos que requiere  el acondicionamiento de un lavadero  para la atención, es así que deciden compartir el negocio, él  se encargaría de la reparación y ella de lavar las motos y carros.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00, comprará franelas, mangueras, detergente aromatizantes  para camionetas, carros, autos, motocicletas lineales y motocarros.
 
Liz Erika, es una  mujer creativa y emprendedora,  actualmente  atienden en un local pequeño,  su sueño es tener su local más grande en donde pueda ofrecer un servicio de mayor calidad a su clientela.   Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder mejorar sus ingresos  y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
Liz Erika is a member of the “Virgen de las Mercedes” community bank in Juanjui district, in Mariscal Cáceres province.  She is 28 years old, and has three sons who are in elementary school.

The idea for the business that Liz is currently engaged came from her husband's business.  Her husband has a motorcycle garage that needed a space fitting out for washing vehicles so that he could provide this service to his customers.  Therefore, the couple decided to share the business: her husband would be in charge of fixing the motorcycles and cars and she would wash them.

Liz will use this loan for 2,200 Peruvian soles to buy cloths, hoses and perfumed deodorants for trucks, cars, motorcycles and three-wheeler vans.

Liz is a creative and entrepreneurial woman.  She currently works in a small location and her dream is to expand it so that she can provide a better-quality service to her customers.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as herself by providing opportunities to increase their incomes and provide their families with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cloths, hoses, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Masimba Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Netsai (in the middle) from Mutare. She is married with five children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. 

Netsai runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets, stoves, TVs and other electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. 

Netsai has requested a loan of $400 to buy electrical appliances and clothing for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's diet and pay her child’s school fees. In the future Netsai plans to have a business that is always well stocked.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Krasnoe, Marneuli District, West Georgia. This district is well known in the country for its agriculture, in particular vegetable- and fruit-growing. 

Giorgi is requesting a loan to increase the stock in trade in his small greengrocery located in his village. Giorgi is 32 years old and lives with his wife Tamara, his mother and his grandmother. He is the only income provider in the family. He purchases fruits and vegetables in Marneuli at wholesale prices and sells them with a price mark-up in the village. 

The total average monthly income of the family amounts to 990 Laris, including the pension of Giorgi’s grandmother. In the summer period there are a variety of fruits and vegetables and Giorgi’s existing cash isn’t enough to supply all of them for his store. With the requested credit he will increase the assortment of products and encourage greater turnover in the store. This will positively impact his profit. Giorgi plans to reinvest about half of the profit in his business and the other half will be used to cover daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for his greengrocery store.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 33 years old and is single. She has been operating a well-organized business selling women's clothes for one year. Her business is open from 7am until 5pm daily. She employs one person to help her.

Francine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more women's clothes to sell. With the profit, Francine will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with 12 children, three of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

For the past seven years, he has operated a farming business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During hot summer season, he experiences droughts that lead to low production of produce. He dreams of becoming a big supplier of farm produce in the future.

With the KES 60,000 he wants to purchase six cattle's each costing Kshs 10,000 for his farming business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase six cattle's each costing Kshs 10,000 for his farming business.

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es: Aurora Elena de 64 años, reside en su hogar. Aurora es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, ya que con muchos esfuerzos ha hecho crecer una pequeña pulpería en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad como: huevos, azúcar, arroz, leche, golosinas, etc. Para ella  su familia lo es todo y es la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día para darles todo lo que se merecen. Para poder cumplir su sueño necesita seguir manteniendo activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito con la esperanza de comprar diversidad de productos como: azúcar, huevos, aceite, arroz, leche, golosinas, frijoles, papel, etc. Para poder surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Aurora Elena, 64, resides at home. Aurora is a working woman and entrepreneur.  With much effort she has built a small general store, which offers a range of staples such as eggs, sugar, rice, milk, candy, etc.  For Aurora, family is everything and is the reason that she strives every day to give them everything they deserve. To fulfill her dream, she needs to continue to actively maintain her business for a longer period of time as it is their main source of income.  She decided to apply for this loan in the hope of buying diverse products such as sugar, eggs, oil, rice, milk, candy, beans, paper, etc. to stock her store and offer customers a variety of products.  With this loan, she hopes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, oil, rice, milk, candy, beans, and paper.

loans.name: Fenton

texts.en:
Fenton is 32 years old and married. He is a motorcycle operator and also owns a fuel business. Both businesses have been in operation for one year. This is his second loan from KADET to finance his businesses.

Fenton plans to use the loan to purchase more fuel for his fuel business. The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful sole proprietor.

loans.use: purchase more fuel for his fuel business

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita believes that "poverty is not a hindrance to success." She is now 31 years old and still single. Due to hardships in life, she only took a vocational course. Because of the lack of job opportunities, she manages a general store in the village to earn income. She has been in this business for almost four years, now earning a profit of only 5,000 Philippines pesos (P) a month. 

She aimed to make her business grow to increase her income and help her parents in financing the education of her younger brothers and sister, and to save for her future. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy additional stock of shampoo, spices, soaps, breads, candies, snack foods, beverages and soft drinks to sell in the village. She hopes that the loan will help her to make her business viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shampoo, spices, soaps, breads, candies, snack foods, beverages and soft drinks to sell in the village.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 7 years.  He is 40 years old and married to Beth.  They have two children who attend school. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Daniel hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years old and has a furniture workshop in Kitengela town. He has run this business for four years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of ther field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use this loan to buy a circular saw and more timber to add to his stock. 

In the future, Nelson hopes to open another furniture shop at the Athi River Market and later own a big furniture store.

loans.use: to purchase a circular saw and timber.

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa Del Carmen de 39 años. Tiene su negocio que es la venta de leche, hielo y bisutería se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre esta ofreciéndoles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Yulisa es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante para ella la disciplina es el mejor secreto en el trabajo, porque le permite realizar tus metas en el futuro, se ha decidido a solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar leche, bisutería. ella tiene fe que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yulisa Del Carmen is 39 years old and has a business selling milk, ice and costume jewelry.  She has a lot of customers because she always offers her customers a good service.  Yulisa is a very hard-working woman who has a desire to get ahead in life.  Her best secret in her work is discipline because it allows her to achieve her future goals.

Yulisa has decided to request a loan which will allow her to buy milk and costume jewelry.  She is certain that, through her efforts, she will manage to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk and costume jewelry

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with three school going children. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent. 

Fatuma has operated a cosmetics shop for the past ten years; her potential clients are the women of her community. She faces the major challenge of rent for her business premises. She dreams of having a wide variety of products at her cosmetics shop.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson, a hardworking 25-year-old, lives in Kasese, Uganda where he has been operating a boutique and retail shop for five years. Edson started with capital of 2,000,000 shillings saved from a previous saloon business and now has 10,000,000 shillings.

Facing the business hardships of price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital, Edson is requesting this loan to buy shoes, clothes and soap for resale. His personal goal is self-education, and his business goal is the operation of a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and soap to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Rober used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to buy laboratory apparatus, and as a result has been able to work more efficiently and thus improve his business.  He is now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a microscope.

loans.use: to buy a microscope.

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es:
Don Heliodoro tiene 66 años de edad, esta casado y actualmente tiene 6 hijos que dependen de él, su actividad principal es la caficultura, cuenta con más de 30 años en el manejo y cultivo de café, esta actividad ha sido la fuente de ingresos que recibe anualmente para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Don Heliodoro utilizara el credito para comprarse un panel de energia Solar y poder tener iluminada su casa ya que ha sido un deseo de él y de toda su familia poder gozar de este servicio, las posibilidades de que tengan energía eléctrica son bien remotas y toda su vida se ha iluminado con candiles y en ocasiones con velas.
gracias a este panel solar podran mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heliodoro is 66 years old, married, and currently has six children who are dependent on him.  His main business activity is coffee growing.  He has been growing coffee for more than 30 years.  This business has been a yearly source of income which has enabled him to cover his family expenses.

Heliodoro will use his loan to buy a solar panel so that he can light his house.  It has been his wish, and that of his whole family, to be able to enjoy this service.  The possibility of having electricity is very remote and he has lit his home with oil lamps, and occasionally candles, his whole life.  Thanks to this solar panel, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Felipa Isabel

texts.es:
La señora es casada, de 25 años de edad, estudio la primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual no estudian aun, se dedica a la tejeduría, y ahora quiere construir un vivero para verduras, lleva 7 años de experiencia en el trabajo de tejeduría.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizará para la  construcción de un vivero para verduras, específicamente para tomate, ya que sueña tener un gran vivero y producir frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The lady is married and 25 years old.  She has an elementary school education. She has a son who is not in school yet.  She makes a living in weaving and is now wanting to build a garden for vegetables.  She has been in weaving for 7 years.

She is requesting this loan which she will use to build a bed for vegetables, especially tomatoes.  She wants to have a large garden and produce fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to build a bed for vegetables.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en: Janeffer is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been farming for two years. She also operates a retail shop to generate more income. She has improved her business through previous loans from Faulu Kenya that have helped improve her living standards. Janeffer hopes to become financially stable in the future. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and maize flour

loans.name: Guarani - Ka’Aguy Group

texts.es:
El comité “Guarani – Ka’aguy” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la Ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto, para que de esa forma sirvan de ayuda, no solo para ellas mismas sino también para sus familias. Ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Francisca, quien se dedica al macate(venta ambulante) de frazadas, sabanas, ollas y demás tipos de productos. Ella comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que tiene que recorrer grandes distancias para ofrecer sus productos, pero nos cuenta que esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honrado.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva para la compra de sabanas, frazadas y demás productos, con lo que tendrá más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee, "Guarani-Ka'aguy" was created by several female neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All of the members partake in independent activities but they also have some that they do together with the intention of helping not only themselves but also their families.  They have formed a very united and capable group that have strengthened their friendship through the accomplishment of projects together.  

One of the members is Francisca, who is a vendor of blankets, sheets, pots, and other products.  She comments that she sacrifices a lot for her job since she needs to cover long distances in order to sell her products.  However, she tells us that she is very proud of what she does since it's a dignified and honorable job.  She is seeking a loan from this foundation and from Kiva so that she may purchase sheets, blankets, and other products in order to have more variety to offer to her clients.

loans.use: purchase blankets, sheets, and other products to be sold.

loans.name: Unidas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité "Unidas de San Antonio"se originó a traves de promociones  que se realizó en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa por medio del esfuerzo de todas.
La sra. Ana es la Presidenta del grupo, ella  tiene un puesto enfrente a su casa donde vende todo lo que han producido en la chacra que ella tiene. Nos comenta que su trabajo es muy pesado ya que debe de cosechar y luego sembrar, además de eso estar pendiente de plagas y de más problemas, pero pese a ello le gusta lo que hace por que es un trabajo digno y decoroso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para utilizar en el campo, lo cual es su medio de vida. Está muy agradecida con la fundación con esta oportunidad que le da, pues muchas instituciones no lo harina.
texts.en:
The “Unidas de San Antonio” Communal Bank was started through promotions that were held in the neighborhood. All the members are from the same area; they are neighbors and acquaintances from the neighborhood. The objective of each one of them is to work, promote a spirit of solidarity and reach the highest level of the program through the efforts of all.

Sra. Ana is the president of the group. She has a stand in front of her house where she sells everything she has produced on the small farm she has. She tells us that her work is hard since she needs to harvest and then plant. In addition to this she is at the mercy of infestations and other problems. However, despite this, she enjoys what she does because it is honest, dignified work.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to use on her fields, which are her source of livelihood. She is very grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity they are giving her, since many institutions would not do so.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Estefany

texts.es: La señora Estefany se dedica a la venta de ropa dese hace dos años, ella tiene 21 años y tiene una hija de 3 años, ella es madre soltera debido a que se separo de su cónyuge, vive en casa alquilada ella y su hija en la zona de Puntiti, la señora Estefany se dedica al comercio de ropa, ella vende los días lunes, miércoles, jueves, viernes, sábados y domingo. Ella es ambulante no tiene un puesto fijo, aprovecha los días de feria en la localidad de Sacaba, y los días de feria en el centro de Cochabamba para vender su mercadería. El préstamo que pide es para incrementar capital de trabajo y también busca adquirir nuevos modelos por cambio de temporada, la Sra. Estefany se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estefany sells clothes for a living and has been in business for two years.  She is 21, divorced, and has a 3-year-old daughter.  They live in a rented house in the Puntiti area.  Her workdays are Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  She is a traveling saleslady and has no fixed stall, but sells her goods on fleamarket days in the town of Sacaba and downtown Cochabamba.  

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital so she can buy apparel for the new season.  Estefany is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for the new season.

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим  жизнерадостный мужчина. который занимается куплей и продажей фруктов. Он женат и имеет двоих детей, жена домохозяйка. Абдулкосим с помощью кредитов смог увеличить свой товарооборот. На получаемую прибыль от своей торговли он  смог отремонтировать свою комнату и купить новый телевизор. А теперь на запрашиваемую сумму хочет привезти партию бананов и мандаринов оптом. Абдулкосим выражает благодарность организации и инвесторам за финансирование.
texts.en: Abdulkosim is a cheerful man, who is involved in buying and selling fruits.  He is married and has two children, and his wife is a homemaker.  Abdulkosim was able to increase his product turnover, with the help of creditors.  He was also able to use the profits to repair his room and buy a new television.  And now he wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of bananas and tangerines.  Abdulkosim expresses gratitude to the organization and investors for the financing.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and tangerines

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 52 years old. She has two children whom are adult. She sells pork in the market for a living. She has done this job for 8 years and gained from it 3,800,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her pork stall in the market. Then she will use the benefit for opening her child’s construction material store.

loans.use: to enlarge her pork stall in the market. Then she will use the benefit for opening her child’s construction material store.

loans.name: Erlan

texts.en: Mr.Erlan is 24 years old, lives with his mother and his brother and sister. He is not married. His mother is pension. He has been running the transportation service business from 2009, because he needs to maintain one`s family. In winter time, he is transporting a coal by old Russian truck from the minings and selling to local residents. He transports  10 tons coal in one time. The cost of a ton coal is 23,000 MNT and service price is 60,000 MNT.  In summer time he transports foods and other goods. Now he is asking a 3,000,000 MNT loan for repair his truck and buy spare parts of truck.  Now his business is successfully running because he is a hardworking and popular man.

loans.use: To repair his truck and buy spare parts of truck

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
This is Roxanne, 38, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ronie, a vendor and a mother to their children. She, together with husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Roxanne operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php26, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Roxanne hopes to expand her business and have more customers and dreams to have a better means of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice is a widow with three children. After successfully graduating middle school, Bernice is now an established businesswoman. She operates a drugstore (chemical store) in Wegbe (near Hohoe). She was actively involved in this business with her husband (before he passed away) as well as another business. She has been in this business for about 32 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Bernice uses her income to provide for the entire family. Bernice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of medication (malaria medication since there has been increased in malaria in her community, pain killers, and cough mixtures), thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to diversify the type of drugs that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of medication, thus helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza was born in 1967 year. She is married and has 4 children. Firuza began her business deal with growing potatoes and crops 15 years ago. She has a great experience in this field. Firuza’s husband helps her with managing business. The only source of income is from agricultural activity. Her son is a student. He studies at the university and dreams to work in any office in future. Firuza must to pay for education of her son but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to pay for education of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for education of her son

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida avec trois enfants à charge. Akouvi est âgée de 37 ans et est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akouvi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice et relancer son activité afin de pouvoir soutenir au mieux son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Akouvi is a married woman who lives in Baguida with three dependent children. She is 37 years old and a charcoal reseller. She buys her charcoal supply in the market three times a month and resells it in front of her home. Akouvi needs this loan to order and finance the bags of charcoal for resale. The additional income she earns will enable her to continue her business and to best help her husband with the family's expenses. It also makes it possible for their children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marie Philippine

texts.fr:
Marie  Philippine a 31  ans, elle est mariée. Le mari  travaille comme maçon. Le couple a 3 enfants âgés de 10, 14, et 16 ans dont les deux aînés scolarisés dans des écoles privées et le dernier dans un établissement primaire public. Des efforts ont té effectués pour pouvoir éduquer les enfants.  Le ménage vit dans une maison héritée des parents.  Le rêve est de pouvoir construire leur propre maison , et d’assurer la réussite des enfants  dans leurs études. 
Marie  Philippine vend des fruits et des produits de la petite quincaillerie. La vente de fruits est une nouvelle activité créée depuis deux mois (activité saisonnière) , tandis que la vente des produits de la petite quincaillerie a débuté depuis deux années , les prêts antérieurs ( 3 prêts)  lui ont permis de développer  ces activités génératrices de revenus depuis qu’elle s’est mariée. Elle travaillait dans une entreprise franche avant.

loans.use: acheter des articles de quincaillerie: cable, rallonges, prises, ampoules, tourne vis

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima lives in Makangarawe area in Dar es Salaam. Salima owns a charcoal store near her residence and she is frequently faced with stockouts.

She needs to increase the size & quality of the stock to smoothly run her charcoal business. Her own savings constitute 20% of her total expansion requirements. She needs a working capital boost of USD 400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, who was born in 1989, lives in a household of 4 in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Maryam took a loan for her older brother who has a cosmetics store in the bazaar where he sells perfume, lipstick, scarfs, purses, etc.

Maryam is studying in year 7 and working part time sewing clothes for neighbours. She took the loan to increase her brother's business and cover her family financially.

loans.use: To buy perfume, lipstick, scarfs, purses, etc.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.en:
Juan de Dios is an entrepreneurial and responsible man who wants to provide the best for his family. He is married with four children. He works as a laborer in a firm, but the salary he earns is not enough to cover the household expenses. For this reason, five years ago he started his own business in which he sells kitchen and footwear articles in his home city of García, Nuevo León. This is how Juan earns the extra income he needs for the home and for his children's schooling.

At this time, Juan is in need of a loan in the amount of $675 to acquire merchandise. He would like to increase his sales and knows that to make that possible, he will have to offer a larger selection to his customers. He is offering to repay this amount within 6 to 12 months. You can improve the life of this family by supporting Juan in his business. Don't hesitate any longer, they are waiting for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan de Dios es un hombre emprendedor y responsable, que desea darle lo mejor a su familia, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, trabaja de obrero en una empresa, pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, por esta razón, desde hace cinco años, inició su propio negocio donde comercializa artículos de cocina y calzado, en la localidad de García, Nuevo León, de donde es originario, es esta manera en la que Juan obtiene el ingreso extra que necesita para su hogar y para la escuela de sus hijos.

En estos momentos Juan necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 675 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, porque quiere incrementar sus ventas y sabe que será posible si tiene más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, él ofrece regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, apoyando a Juan con su negocio, no lo dudes más, ellos te están esperando.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Dieu
