texts.en: Mrs Dieu is 49 and her husband is 49 years old. They have 3 children between 23 and 19 who are going to the university. They have 8000 square meters of land for growing rice. Her husband works as a laborer but the work is not stable and the expense of tuition is high, so Dieu’s selling food for breakfast is important for increasing their income by about $1/person/month, bringing it to an average of $11.5/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 for her selling business.

loans.use: Selling food for breakfast

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Mrs. Ramita M., 26, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and two sons. Her older son is in grade 7 and her younger son is only two years old.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Krishna M., both make traditional idols. They have almost six years of experience in this field. In Nepal, idol making is very popular work and the demand for idols is increasing. So they need money to buy raw materials like brass, silver, wax and gold to make more idols to fulfill the demand. She seeks a $150 loan to buy such materials.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making traditional idols

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise and a display case

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is a 43-year-old widow. Her husband died in the year 2000 due to HIV-related illness. She lives with her seven children, four of whom are in school. After her husband's death, she ventured into three businesses in order to sustain herself and her children. She sells cereals, new clothes, and fish, especially sardines ("omena" in the local language). She attends the Luanda market where displays and sells her merchandise on Mondays and Thursdays, the locals' market days. With the US$700 loan, she plans to buy a large stock of cereals and new clothes which will be in high demand during the Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase stock of cereals and new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye and sells toys in the local Angolenko market. Galina has been in this business for 12 years. She has gained rich experience and always knows what toys will sell well. Galina offers a nice variety of Lego construction blocks, puzzles, dolls, and other toys that are always in high demand during the Christmas and New Year season. Galina has about US$ 3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about US$ 400.

Galina is requesting a loan of US$ 900 to purchase more inventory wholesale. She sees the opportunity to make money and wants to seize it. She is ready to work longer hours and be challenged to increase her income and succeed eventually. We believe Galina’s genuine appetite for success will help her achieve her business goals.

loans.use: To expand her business venture this Christmas season by purchasing wholesale

loans.name: Maura Eugenia

texts.es:
Maura is a single mother. She has a daughter who helps her around the house. She lives in the La Primavera neighborhood, a place where people have few resources. From a very young age, Maura has had to make her own way and she now works buying and selling women's cosmetics. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and family. She also makes and sells prepared meals because that's what she's had to do to support herself and her daughter, without the help of anyone else.

Maura now needs to buy more cosmetics because her customers are demanding new kinds of products. She'd also like to sell clothing. Her goal is to set up a women's clothing and cosmetics store so that she can dedicate herself full-time to the business she enjoys so much.

Translated by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maura es madre soltera, tiene una hija quien le ayuda con los oficios de la casa, habita en el barrio La Primavera, una zona donde los habitantes son personas de escasos recursos económicos. Esta madre desde muy joven ha trabajado de manera independiente, en estos momentos la se dedica a comprar y vender cosméticos para damas, sus clientas directas son sus vecinas, amistades, familiares y por la noche la señora vende comida casera, es así como esta madre ha salido adelante con su esfuerzo y sin apoyo de nadie.

La señora Maura necesita en estos momentos comprar mas cosméticos debido que las clientas están exigiendo nuevas marcas, fragancias y colores de productos, así como también desean que les ofrezca ropa. La señora tiene como meta el de montar una tienda de ropa y cosméticos para damas, dedicándose de lleno a esta actividad, que tanto le gusta.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Oinihol

texts.ru:
Oinihol Urakovna H. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 38 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a secondary education. She is a housewife. She has a milking cow and sells milk. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase another cow which will increase the amount of milk products she can sell and which in turn will boost her sales. She plans to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хатамова Ойнихал Ураковна жительница района Рудаки .Возраст 38 лет , замужем имеет 3 детей. Образованние среднее. Домохозяйка, занимается животноводством.Имеет дойную корову, молоко которой использует для реализации. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести еще одну корову для того чтобы увеличить объем получаемой продукции тем самым увеличивая свой доход. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing a milking cow

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en: Mrs. Chhet K., 45, is a widow who lives with her son in Preah Mlou Village, Pursat Province. She earns $2 per day selling beef at the village market. K. requests a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike so she can transport beef to the market more easily than before. She feels this investment will improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike so she can transport beef to the market more easily than before

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu P. is 35 years old living in Siem Reap province. She is a farmer providing for her family with the rice and vegetables she grows in small fields by her house. The leftover crop makes her 1 US$ per day on average. Her husband, Kung Samnang, is 36 years old and a construction foreman. He brings in the majority of the family income at 5 US$ per day.

They have had five children already, however, all of them are young and the family is not yet prepared to send them to school. As time goes on, they will allow them one by one to be educated, depending on the family’s financial situation. As her husband is the primary bread winner for their household, she wants to provide a motorbike for him to get from job to job around the city. If he can help manage a greater number of construction projects, then their income will rise, possibly allowing them to send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwari B. is 28 years old. Her husband's name is M. I., who is two years older than her. She is a mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Her husband has a furniture business. She wants to expand her husband’s business, therefore she has applied for a loan.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members named: Rubina B. who wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Yasmeen B. wants a loan to buy a shop where her husband can start work as a barber. Sughran B. wants a loan to buy tea sets for her cafeteria.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Estelbina Del Socorr

texts.es:
Estelbina del Socorro Sánchez is a hard-working woman that has a business selling food in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega. It was very difficult in the beginning because she only made a few dishes, but as time has passed the number has increased and she has managed to improve her situation.

Nowadays, she has steady clients that frequent her locale and thanks to them she has managed to achieve high sales and maintain her family, composed of her small son, for whom she has to be mother and father since she doesn't have a husband. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to request a necessary loan for the purchase of raw ingredients for the production of her platters to continue supporting her little son.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Estelbina del Socorro Sánchez es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque comenzó a elaborar pocos platillos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo los fue aumentando hasta mejorar su situación.

Hoy en día posee clientes fijos que le visitan y gracias a estos ha logrado realizar altas ventas y así ha mantenido su núcleo familiar compuesto por su pequeño hijo que mantener ya que al no poseer esposo ella hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez. Por este motivo es que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el creidito necesario para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients for prepared dishes

loans.name: Tatu's Nuru Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 25 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 2. She owns a clothing shop, which she started in 1999. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing with snack sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 42 years old. She is married with five kids. Currently, Vida supports all her kids in school. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice balls and "banku". Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production costs. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Vida is a member of a group called 'Nyame do' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang D., 38, is married with four children and has a stand at a market where she sells a variety of vegetables, making around $3 each day. Her husband works as a sculptor and typically earns around $5 per day. In order to fulfill her client's needs, Mrs. Yang D. would like to request a loan to expand her inventory and to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Negwako

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 20 year old Negwako M. from Mbeya. She is married with a one-year-old child. Negwako has been running a traditional African cloth business since 2003. Her business is purchasing Traditional African cloth in whole sale and selling them in retail. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee and her sister. Negwako currently earns about $100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $350USD in order to purchase additional stock of traditional African cloth. In the future, she plans to open another business. Negwako thanks you for your support!

Negwako has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Negwako would like to purchase additional stock of traditional African cloth to resell.

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.en:
Khayrullo is married and has four children. He keeps his family together through dedication and lots of hard work as a farmer. He has worked in this area for the past 10 years, and has gained much knowledge and skill in the cultivation of wheat, corn, potatoes and other crops. Because he is a totally dedicated to his work, he spends most of his time on his farm, which demands total commitment. 

Khayrullo has applied for a loan of $600 for nine months to buy more supplies, especially seeds and mineral fertilizer. This loan will allow him to earn more money and educate all of his children. Khayrullo has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006, and his credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. Please consider helping increase the well-being of this hard-working young man and his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 26 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos, en casa de su madre. La niñez de Mery fue muy precaria, para ella su juguete era la sartén sujeta a un mango, le era útil para cavar la tierra, pasaron los años y su labor agrícola no ha cambiado, pero con gran alegría espera  las temporadas de cosecha de papa que han cultivado con su esposo. Negociar sus productos en el mercado le produce gran satisfacción, su esposo y ella están convencidos que es su única fuente de trabajo y le es rentable por el momento, les permite devolver la inversión  realizada y cubrir sus gastos, no tiene dificultades en su chacra, pero sí con su hijo menor que se enferman constantemente, y eso les ocasionan gastos en su recuperación. Es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y no tiene dificultades en sus pagos, y está agradecida con todos aquellos que le apoyan para que pueda sembrar. El dinero solicitado será destinado para la compra de abono, considera que quizás le falte una cantidad por el alto costo de los fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Mery is 26 years old, and lives in the company of her husband and two children in her mother's house. Mery's childhood was very unstable; her toy was a frying pan with a handle, which was useful for her to dig the land. The years passed and her agricultural work had not changed, but with great happiness she waits for the time to harvest the potatoes that she has cultivated with her husband. Selling her products in the market produces great satisfaction, she and her husband are convinced that it's her only source of work and it's profitable for the moment. It allows them to repay their investment and cover their expenses. She doesn't have difficulties in her farm, but her oldest son is constantly falling ill, this causes expenses for his recovery. This is the ninth time that she has a loan with MFP, and she has no difficulties making her payments, and she is grateful to all of those who support her so she can plant. The money requested will be for buying fertilizer; she believes she will be lacking some due to the high cost of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her land

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en: Tauva A., 56, is widowed with one child.  She has four years of experience selling general goods from her shop. She sells to the public and to villagers six days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about US$250).  SPBD loans are Tauva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also has a farm run by an employee, and this helps augment her income from the shop.

loans.use: Re-stocking of the shop

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 45-year-old married man with three children, living in Taalabaya in the Bekaa Valley. He has been working in installation and maintenance of satellite dishes since 1998. Mahmoud wants to buy cables, for better service and in order to increase his profits; therefore, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Buy cables

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna F. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Anna sells plastic products and soft drinks near the Elmina police station, which she has done since 2003. Anna uses her income to pay rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses.

Anna will use the loan to purchase more plastic products and soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Anna plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: A purchase more plastic products and soft drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Chiên  năm nay 44  tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Gia đình  chị có 3 con trong đó có hai con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại chị ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn còn chồng chị đi đóng gạch thuê. Ngoài ra con trai chị đã có công ăn việc làm ổn định hàng tháng đều hỗ trợ thêm cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chi đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Chiên is 44 years old, a TYM fund member since 2006. She has 3 children, 2 of which are still in school. She raises pigs at home and her husband is a brick layer. Their son holds a steady job and contributes to the family income which is stable at 2.000.000 VND a month. For this round of loan she is requesting 10.000.000 to buy pis to raise and food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for animals

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama D. est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 2 enfants qui  vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans la  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu à fréquenter l’école pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Adama D. s’essaya à plusieurs activités économiques notamment la vente d’habits , de chaussures, de tasses etc. Ces activités ne lui ont pas réussies, il opta finalement  pour l’ouverture une boutique d’articles divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de grand frère.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier individuel.
Monsieur Adama D.  compte  acheter  une diversité d’articles pour  boutique à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de toutes les catégories sociales de la population.
Avec ce prêt, Adama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui servira à agrandir sa boutique et à assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama D., 38, is married and the father of 2 children; he lives with his wife and children in the Hérémakono North district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having been unable to attend school for societal reasons, Mr. Adama D. tried out various businesses, notably selling clothing, shoes, basins, etc. None of these businesses was successful, so he finally decided to open a general store. He learned this business from his big brother.

As he searched for complementary financial resources, he turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy many varied items for his shop in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). His clientele is composed of all social strata.

With this loan Adama D. expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will be used to expand his shop and support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A. is 19 years old. She is married and a good mother to her child. Her husband goes into traditional gold mining. Margie and her family live in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City.

Margie is engaged in a mini-grocery store business and gasoline and rice retailing in their place. Margie works hard at her business. She wants to have savings for the education of her child.

Margie want to express her thanks to HSPFI (her Kiva Partner) for helping her business boom and gain profit for real. Margie is now applying for a loan of PHP 11,000. This amount is intended for the purchase of stock for her store and, of course, for the entire improvement of her business. Margie is now hoping for the best response to her request.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her mini-grocery store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is married with 2 children and has received an education through Senior High School. Rose works as a seamstress and also sells beverages such as Malt, Fanta and Coca Cola at Siwdo near Cape Coast.  She has been in business for three years and her husband is employed as a driver. Rose uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees.  Rose will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to add to the capital of her business and to further expand her enterprise.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. sells firewood. She is 33 years old and married with three children.

She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of N30,000 to purchase more firewood to sell.

She sends many thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Carlos Alberto E. tiene la edad de 48 años. Su estado civil es casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Carlos es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, Carlos comenzó este negocio por su necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el alimento diario, Carlos tuvo dificultades al inicio ya que no estaba muy bien de salud por lo que todo el día recorría las calles y tenia problemas en la columna, y muchas veces tenia que soportar el dolor para cubrir con la responsabilidad de ofrecer el alimento diario a su familia. El  motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos, mantenimiento del vehiculo y además comprar llantas y reparar los asientos. El sueño de Carlos es comprar otro vehiculo y enseñarle a sus hijos a ganarse la vida de una manera decente.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto E. is 48 years old and married. He has 2 children under his care who both study. Carlos offers taxi services. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 5 years. Carlos started this business due to his necessity to provide food daily to his children; at first Carlos faced difficulties due his poor health that was caused by his daily street travels that gave him spine problems. Many times he has to endure the pain to fulfill his responsibilities of providing his family food daily. The purpose of the loan is to serve as work capital to purchase parts, carry out vehicle maintenance, purchase tires, and repair the seats. Carlos’ dreams of purchasing another vehicle and teaching his children to earn an honest living.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase parts, carry out vehicle maintenance, purchase tires, and repair the seats).

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is 29 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has been selling fruit and vegetables for seven years. Hicham requested a loan of $700 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Hicham is successful in his work because he sells good quality products and knows how to treat his customers, who are friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Hicham set up his fruit and vegetable business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Заботливая мать 3 детей и любящая жена  Махбуба Джураева имеет 15 летний опыт работы в сфере животноводства. Махбуба проживает вместе со своей семьей в городе Истаравшане. Благодаря своему трудолюбию  в течении 15 лет, она смогла укрепить сферу своей деятельности. Дополнительным семейным доходом, которым занимаются супруги, является выращивание сельхозкультур. 
Махбуба запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони, для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
A caring mother of 3 children and a loving wife, Mahbuba D. has 15 years of experience in the animal husbandry field. Mahbuba lives together with her family in the city of Istaravshan. Thanks to her hard work during the last 15 years, she has been able to strengthen her business. In addition, Mahbuba and her husband supplement their income with agriculture. Mahbuba is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni for livestock feeding and milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and milk processing

loans.name: Mrs. Sinuon Uk Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Sinuon U. Village Bank Loan Group is made up of 20 people located in the Tuol Trea village in TaK. Province. All of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sinuon U. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Suong Veasna, is a fisherman. In these two businesses, Mrs. Sinuon U. faces problems because her rice field is infertile soil so it has affected her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. She will use the rest of her loan to buy a boat for her husband's business. Mrs. Sinuon U. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is only 3 years old so is still too young to work or study. All the group loan members are presented in the picture but most of them are blocked.

Seventeen members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. C. is a mother of five children whose ages are from nine to 21 years old. Nancy and her her fisherman husband wasn't able to sustain their eldest child's education after high school because the variety store business she put up when she loaned from ASHI in 2003 is not yet stable at that time the same as her husband's fishing business. After several loans, she was able to improve her business and now she has the ability to finance the education in college of her second child, her two children in high school and youngest in elementary. In her past loans and profits, she has able to purchase three fishing boat in support to her husband's fishing business. Now, Nancy wants to request for a larger amount of loan in addition to their growing fishing business. Fishes her husband will catch are to be sold by Nancy in their village and to some people wanting to sell fish in the market.
With all of her plans for the growth of their businesses, Nancy would be happier if her children will be able to graduate from college and have their own life out of poverty.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
65-years old Pacita G. is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till their 1-hectare (~ 2.5 acre) farm in 1978. In 1980, her husband died and she was left behind to manage their rice farm and look after the needs of their 26-year-old child.

She needs a loan of Php 6,000 to pay for farming necessities like the seeds that she has sown and the laborers who helped to till the field. Some of the loan will also be used to buy feed, because she just started raising pigs.

Pacita joined CEVI in 2008. She likes the services because CEVI has only 2% interest rate, which is very affordable to repay.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: S., 47, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. S. is married with three children, while her husband works on the farm. S. applies for a loan to purchase more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Danny

texts.en: Danny is an active farmer from Agusan Del Sur. At 43, he now has three children with his wife. Rice farming is where he gets his income and he works hard to feed his family and meet their daily needs. Danny is a new member of CEV and he is thankful for the financial services he can now avail from the organization. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000. He will use this loan to purchase farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 38 years old. Her husband's name is Manuel, and they have three children: Niño Gabriel, 17 and a high school graduate; Manilyn, 11 and in elementary school; and Mary Joy, 1 year old. Myrna makes handicrafts which she sells in their village. She makes flowers made of newspaper. Aside from vending flowers, she also offers massages, since she is a graduate of reflexology. Her husband is in full support of her business.

Myrna would like to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP7000 to be used for business improvement. She would be thankful if this amount could be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann S. lives in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sap, is a motorbike taxi driver. Now Mrs. Sarann S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, sewing machine, and she would use the rest of money to repair motorbike. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a tailor while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, sewing machine, and she would use the rest of money to repair motorbike.

loans.name: Fatenah

texts.en:
Fatenah was one of the first borrowers from FATEN’s Hebron branch. She has taken more than ten loans that began with 150 USD.

Fatenah’s business started with FATEN and gradually grew. Now her business is the main source of income for her family which consist of eight members. She even helped her husband to begin work as a taxi driver.

Fatenah has requested 3,000 USD from FATEN to buy some products for her shop since Eid al-Adha is very close.  She appears in the photo at her store.

loans.use: To purchase some products for her grocery store

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita D. P. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Jovita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Jovita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jovita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional meat products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat products to sell

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita, 52 years old, is a married woman. She farms for a living. She plants rice crops on her farm. She sells the harvest and saves some for her family’s consumption. Marianita wants to increase her income so she works hard to make her farm productive.

Needing additional capital, she turned to the Kiva field partner, CEVI, a micro-finance institution in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP. Marianita will use this loan to buy seeds, complete fertilizers and other farm supplies. She will also buy crude oil for the tractor.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Madame Amy M. habite dans la localité de Camberene et a déjà rembourse deux crédits antérieurs au sein de l’U-IMCEC. Elle est parent bénéficiaire, mariée. Elle évolue dans le commerce de parfum, d’habits, de produits divers, de jus, de glace et de crème glacée. Elle capitalise une expérience de 7 ans dans cette activité. C’est sa coépouse qui avait l’habitude de voyager au Mali pour acheter des marchandises qui lui ’a donne l’inspiration qui l’a conduit à choisir cette activité pour gagner sa vie. Madame M. sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renforcer ses produits en vue d’accroitre au maximum ses bénéfices. Actuellement elle constitue un véritable soutien de famille, son mari ne disposant plus de revenus c’est elle qui supporte les charges sociales de la maison.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy M. lives in the Camberene area and has already repaid two previous loans through UIMCEC. She is a parent and is married. She works selling perfume, clothes, miscellaneous items, juice, ice and ice-cream. She has built up 7 years of experience in this trade. It was her co-wife who used to travel to Mali to buy merchandise which inspired her to choose this business as her livelihood. Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for 100,000 frs to stock up on products with a view to maximising her profits. Nowadays she is a real help to her family, her husband no longer has to pay out as it is she who covers household expenses.

With a continuing focus on active participation in the fight against poverty, UIMCEC, with help from lenders, succeeds in supporting people to run their own income-generating businesses, which promotes social and economic development.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital to buy and sell various items

loans.name: Jova Noemi

texts.es:
Jova P. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil. Su esposo es taxista, con el tiene 1 hijo esta embarazada de una niña. 

Jova comenzó a estudiar hace 4 años belleza, empezó con una plancha y algunos utensilios de belleza, poco a poco incremento su capital y puso un gabinete de belleza.

Jova ahora trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, haciendo cortes de cabellos, tinturados, cepillados, planchados etc. No ha tenido complicaciones desde que comenzó el negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una plancha de cabello, cremas, tratamientos para tener más variedad. En el futuro quiere tener otro gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Jova P. is 25 years old, and lives in a suburban area of Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her husband is a taxi driver; with him she has one son and is also expecting a daughter. Jova began studying as a beautician 4 years ago, and started out with an iron and some beauty implements. Little by little, she saved up and opened a beauty salon. Now Jova works from 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day giving hair cuts, colouring, brushing, straightening, etc. She has not experienced any complications since starting the business. With this loan, she will buy a straightening iron, creams, and treatments in order to have more variety. Someday she hopes to open another salon.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irons, creams, treatments

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita T. is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in various business activities: she raises pigs, runs a general store,  has a passenger tricycle, and sells food. She lives in Bucrus Daku Brgy Ayungon La Carlota, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their two children, who are 19 and 16 years old; both children currently go to school.

Helenita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening, general store, tricyle and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500.

Helenita is now borrowing PHP 15,000 for her pig fattening and general store businesses. This will be her 14th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Helenita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Victoria se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos de la región, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a tiendas y también en el mercado.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar y levadura.
Los sueños de Victoria son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su horno.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Twenty-seven years old, she is a live-in partner and has one child. In a rented oven, she bakes breads which are typical of her region. She sells to stores and also in the market. Victoria needs a loan of $500 to purchase flour, sugar, and yeast. Victoria's dream is to buy land on which to build her oven.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and yeast

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Gladis Maria L. García, es madre de dos hijas en edad escolar, es de profesión secretaria, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de dos casas comercializadoras en el país, de estado civil casada y con mucha experiencia en la actividad que le ha permitido mantenerse en el mercado.   Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de estos productos en los cuales obtiene hasta un 35% de ganancia por cada producto colocado y para reparar un taxi, el cual lo trabaja su esposo en la comunidad de san rafael.-
texts.en:
Gladis Maria L. García is the mother of 2 school-aged daughters. She is a secretary, and also sells the cosmetics of two brands that are marketed in the country. She is married, and has a lot of experience that has allowed her to stay in the market. She requests this loan to buy these products, for which she gets a 35% profit for each product sold, and to repair a taxi, which her husband uses in his work in the community of San Rafael.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products such as perfume, body cream, lipstick and powder compacts

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en: Ignacio M. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 45 years old. Ignacio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ignacio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members. Ignacio has been a driver in his "trisikad" (pedicab) for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Ignacio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ignacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Ignacio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This will be the second loan taken out by Ignacio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Aura Del Socorro

texts.es: Aura de 43 años de edad es soltera, vive en el muncipio de San Patricio, tiene 3 hijos, los 2 mayores Jose Teodoro de 23 años e idelka de 20 ya estan casados y tienen su propia familia, solo esta a su cargo la menor de 18 años de nombre Ilsa, la cual no esta estudiando pero le ayuda con los quehaceres de la casa.  Aura trabaja para el MINED de San Patricio desde hace mas de 10 años como conserje.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa, para de esta manera evitar enfermedades a su familia.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y mejorar poco a poco su casita.
texts.en:
43-year old Aura is single and lives in the municipality of San Patricio. She has three children; the two older ones, 23-year old Jose Teodoro and 20-year old Idelka, are married and have their own families, so the only one she supports is 18-year old Ilsa. Ilsa doesn't go to school but instead helps her mother with household chores. Aura has worked for the Ministry of Education of San Patricio for over ten years as a caretaker. This is her second loan, and she wishes to use it to build a bathroom in her house. This will help her family avoid illness. Aura's greatest hope is to have better living conditions and gradually improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Ismael

texts.fr: Monsieur Ismael T. est un jeune célibataire né en 1985.  Il s'est investi depuis 3 ans dans le commerce. Actuellement, il est propriètaire de deux cantines d'alimentation générale dont l'une se trouve au marché et l'autre dans son quartier. Monsieur T. gère gère une des cantines tandis que l'autre est gérée par son jeune frère qui l'aidait très souvent dans ce business. Il vend divers produits alimentaires et condiments. Il sollicite cependant un prêt pour s'approvisionner en oignons, tomates et piments.
texts.en:
Mr. Ismael T. is an unmarried young man born in 1985. He has been investing himself in commerce for three years. Currently, he is the owner of two grocery stalls, including one located at the market and another in his district. He manages one of these stalls, while the other is managed by his younger brother, who has helped him quite often in this business. Ismael sells a variety of foods and condiments. He is however requesting a loan for supplies of onions, tomatoes, and chili peppers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of goods

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane S. est un homme de 52 ans qui habite dans la localité de Dalifort.
Il est  menuisier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il fait des meubles des portes et des fenêtres pour des particuliers surtout des émigrés qui ont des maisons en construction. Il a des clients partout. Il emprunte 200 000 frs pour terminer ses commandes et aussi fabriquer  quelques meubles pour les exposer. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants  et c’est avec ses revenus qui peuvent être estimes a plus de cent milles franc Cfa par mois qu’il entretien sa famille, paie la scolarité de ses enfants et subvient à ses besoins. Monsieur S. a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution ou il est membre depuis 5 ans. Ce prêt lui permettra de terminer  ses commandes et d’entamer d’autres marchés. Son rêve est d’acquérir ultérieurement une machine pour augmenter ses revenus pour mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Souleymane S. is 52 years-old and lives in the town of Dalifort. He has been a carpenter for over 10 years and makes furniture, doors and windows for private customers, mostly emigrés who are building their homes, and has a large customer base. He is seeking a 200 000 FRS loan in order to complete his orders and also to make some furniture items to put on display. He is a married father of three and aims to use this revenue, estimated at around 100 000 FCFA per month in order to see to his family's needs and pay for his children's schooling. Mister S. has already received a loan from the credit association of which he has been a member for over 5 years. This loan would enable him to complete his orders and enter other markets. His dream is to purchase a machine which would enable him to generate higher revenues, thereby helping him to meet his family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Meoun S. is a 29-year old married woman who lives in in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder at home and earns a small income to support her family living. 

Her husband, Mr. Nou Choy, is a chicken middleman who earns a small revenue to add to his wife’s income to improve the family living. This couple has three children; two attend the local school. The youngest one is 4 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

In order to increase her income to improve the family living, Mrs. Meoun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy six more piglets and pig food for pig breeding.

loans.use: To buy more six piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary Lou O. is from the barangay (village) of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years of age and married to Elizardo O., a farmer. They were blessed with nine children. Two of them are adults, three are school-aged, and four are still at their infant or minor age. Mary Lou is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and dried a fish vending business. She has been engaged in these businesses for two years and earns approximately $110 a month from sales at her store and from her dried fish vending business.

 In 2009, Mary Lou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for her businesses. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion and her children’s education.
 
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda  se dedica a la venta de material escolar ya que tiene una librería a lado de un colegio de la zona,  actividad con la que ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del  hogar que esta conformado por el esposo y sus dos hijos los que aun se encuentran en edad  escolar, La Sra. Hilda es muy conocida por la zona  esta hace mucho tiempo con la librería es la única por la zona, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de material escolar como ser cuadernos, hojas, boligrafos, perforadoras, engrampadoras, cartulinas, libros agendas, etc. tiene muchos clientes  también podemos indicar que la cliente es muy responsable con sus obligaciones  y muy trabajadora por  esta razón se le dio la tasa kiva, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Hilda sells school materials in her bookstore located alongside a neighborhood school. This activity enables her to help her husband with household costs. Her family includes her husband and 2 children, both still school-age. Hilda has long been very well known in her neighborhood, since her bookstore is the only one in the area. The loan will be used to purchase school materials, including notebooks, paper, ball-point pens, hole punchers, staplers, quality paste-board, calendar books, etc. She has many customers. We can also state that she is very responsible with her obligations and very hardworking. For this reason, she was recommended to Kiva. Hilda is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE, INCLUDING NOTEBOOKS, PENS, PASTE BOARD, AND OTHER SCHOOL SUPPLIES TO SELL

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.en:
“Los Emprendedores” is a communal bank formed by fourteen socios (borrowers) who reside in La Florida district. These individuals are primarily dedicated to their individual occupation: a seamstress, a baker, an artist (wood pieces), and a salesperson (sells CDs, socks and underwear).

Fabiola is the delegate of this group. In the photo she is found in the back row, second from the right, and is wearing a purple jacket. She bakes pastries, alfajores (a traditional Arabic confection) and various cookies and sells them in a stand that she has created in front of her house. She also distributes wholesale for other business to sell within the neighborhood. Fabiola learned how to make pastries from her father who was a bread-maker and pastry chef.

With this loan, Fabiola intends to purchase the principle ingredients needed to produce these goodies. Her dream is to one day open a pastry shop in a grand location and afterwards add to it a shop that will sell these ingredients for other to make them too.

Febiola lives with her husband and 7-year-old daughter. She enjoys participating in the weekly bank meetings along with the other socias (borrowers) and the loan officer. She credits Fondo Esperanza’s weekly bank meetings with enabling her to socialize with other entrepreneurs and learn from their experiences too.

La Florida is a community located to the southeast of Santiago (the capital of Chile). The community itself is quite diverse, representing all sectors of socioeconomic levels. This area has an active commercial life which is manifested in the existence of several new shopping centers. In recent years, this sector has experienced explosive growth.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients need to produce her pastries

loans.name: Kantai Ole

texts.en:
Kantai Ole P. is 27 years old. He is married to Nairoshi Enole P. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Kantai is a farmer on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last two years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend 80,000 shillings on maize farming on his 10-acre farm. Maize has proved to be doing very well due to fertile soil in the area and adequate rainfall. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his maize production. He also hopes to buy some livestock and start livestock farming.

His future dream is that he will be able to practice large-scale maize farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Maize farming on his 10-acre farm

loans.name: The Divine Women Of The Union Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS DIVINAS DE LA UNION”, está conformada por 7 socios unidos, solidarios y  muy trabajadores que tienen sueños y metas por cumplir.
Desde hace 1 año Angélica se dedica a la venta de desayuno se inicio en este negocio vendiendo refrescos y a veces lava ropa los fines de semana, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprarse una carreta que le facilita su trabajo, menajes y ha logrado ahorrar un pequeño capital para ampliar su negocio. Es una socia muy entusiasta por eso ella representa al grupo como presidenta desde hace 4 meses. El gran sueño de Angélica es alquilar un local para poner ahí su negocio.
EL crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para capital de trabajo, todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy contentos y agradecidos por todas las oportunidades que les dan con los préstamos, porque de esta manera ellos pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida. (Niños en la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Divine women of the Union" is made up of 7 hard working members, all of whom have dreams and goals to accomplish. For the past year Angelica has been serving breakfast. It is a business that started out by only selling soft drinks. Sometimes on the weekends provides laundry services. With her hard work she has managed to purchase a trolley that facilitates her work. She has even saved enough money to have a small capital savings to expand her business. She is a very enthusiastic member, for which reason she was elected to lead the group as president four months ago. Angelica's greatest dream is to rent a space to set up her business. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and for working capital. Every one of the members are very happy and grateful to be given the opportunities granted to them through this loan. They are able to manage a better quality of life through these loans. (The children in the photo are children of the members of this group).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to serve as working capital.

loans.name: Hector Daniel

texts.es:
Héctor de 65 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas. 

Cuando se jubilo el comenzó con su papelería para tener un ingreso fijo. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido aumentar el negocio con unas cabinas telefónicas. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende papelería, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc.  

El quiere con el préstamo comprar papelería y artículos de papelería etc. En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio y poderlo expandir.
texts.en:
65-year old Héctor runs a stationery store out of the front of his house. He lives in Las Orquídeas (The Orchids) neighbourhood, so called because when it was discovered, many orchids grew there. When Héctor retired, he started the store in order to have a regular income. Over time he managed to obtain several telephone booths and expand the business. He works from 7am to 10pm. He sells stationery, notebooks, pens, laminated sheets etc. He wishes to use the loan to buy stationery and other merchandise for the store. In the future he wants to continue running the business and to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stationery etc.

loans.name: Manan-Aw Group

texts.en:
Emmylou V. lives in the village of Mitacas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and leads a three-person loan group called Manan-aw. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Emmylou is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by running a specialized store where she buys and sells dried fish, dry goods and beverages. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Emmylou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and other items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Heart Of Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este comité  Corazón de Jesús es un comité  que está en el quinto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 16 integrantes.
La Sra. Veronica P. quien trabaja dentro del comité posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas sobre una avenida muy concurrida en ciudad.
Para contar con mercaderías frescas ella va al mercado de abasto a comprar las frutas.
Ella vende además jugos naturales, tiene clientela formadas con el ingreso que ella lo realiza día a día ayuda al marido, ingreso en el comité con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas como plátanos, naranjas, manzanas, piñas, peras.
Es un comité donde las integrantes tienen  muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is named "Heart of Jesus" and it is currently on its fifth loan cycle, working together with Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner). There are 16 members in the group. 

Mrs. Veronica P. is a member of the group and she has a small stand from where she sells fruits. The stand is located on a very well traveled street in the city. 

In order to acquire fresh produce, she goes to the market. She also sells fresh fruit juices that she sells to an established client base. With the profits that she earns she helps her husband day after day. She joined the group with the idea of expanding her small business. She requests a loan to purchase fruits such as bananas, oranges, apples, pineapples, and pears. The group collectively has a great desire of self-improvement.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: La Mansión Azul Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada negocio de la señora Juanita R., la cual es integrante del grupo  “LA MANSION AZUL” que está ubicado en Puebla,México. En la foto se ve claramente el pequeño rastro donde sacrifica el ganado caprino que ocupa para la elaboración de barbacoa, en la cual desea invertir con este crédito porque le deja buenas ganancias, lleva 15 años dedicándose a este oficio. Ella comenta que va invertir en el ganado y en los condimentos, porque una de sus metas en la vida es consolidar bien su negocio. La señora Juanita  tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, estudio una C. técnica y le da trabajo a otras personas. En este momento se siente muy contenta porque sus compañeras y ella serán apoyadas con el crédito. El grupo está conformado por diez personas.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the business of Ms. Juanita R., a member of "La Mansión Azul" ["The Blue Mansion"] Group, which is located in Puebla, Mexico.  In the photo, you can clearly see the small table where she slaughters the goats that she keeps for preparing barbecue.  This brings in good profits and she has been doing it for 15 years.  She says that she will use this loan to buy livestock and seasonings, because one of her goals in life is to strengthen her business.  Ms. Juanita is 37 years old, married, has three children, studied for a technical field, and now provides work for other people.  At the moment, she is feeling very content because she and her fellow group members will be supported by this loan.  Their group has ten members.

loans.use: to buy livestock for preparing barbecue

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica a la artesanía y a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes la socia tiene en su casa en el primer piso una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cual ha incorporado artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella vende en un espacio que da a la calle a vista de todo el público aretes hechos manualmente y también llaveros con motivos inkas, La socia también tiene un pequeño terreno el cual produce maíz y papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de aretes ya hechos y otros elementos decorativos en arcilla.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “La amistad de Ollantaytambo” community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco.

Francisca is 51 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She sells handicrafts and also serves in her grocery store.  She has a small grocery store on the first floor of her house in which she also sells hand-made jewelry.  She sells in a space which overlooks the street within view of the public.  She sells hand-made earrings and also keychains with Inca motifs.  She also has a small plot of land where she grows corn and potatoes.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of ready-made earrings and decorative clay items.

She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in buying ready-made earrings and decorative clay items

loans.name: Gerem Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité GEREM YALLA est créé le 24 avril 2010. Lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont organisé leur par affinité et par liens d'amitié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de Maison Familiale Rurale

Madame Khady N., en deuxième position à partir de la droite sur la photo levant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses 8 petits fils. 

Elle fait un commerce d'huile palme, de tissus et de pagnes tissé à la main. 

son crédit lui permettra d'élargir son activité afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices.

Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale par la nourriture et la santé de ses petits fils
texts.en:
The Gerem Yalla solidarity group was created April 24, 2010, when Banc Villageois was launched. The group is made up of 12 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their group was coordinated based on their kinship ties and friendships. The Gerem Yalla group is part of the Banc Villageois de Maison Familiale Rurale.

Madame Khady N., second from the right in the photo, raising her right hand, is the group leader. She is 54 years old. She is is married and the mother of 2 children, as well as being responsible for her 8 grandsons.

Madame N. sells palm oil, fabrics and hand-woven pagnes [traditional, sarong-like wraparounds]. This loan will allow her to expand her business in order to increase her profits.

Madame N. helps to provide for her family by contributing food and assuring the health of her grandsons.

loans.use: Buying palm oil, fabric and pagnes.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a forty-eight-year-old married man with seven children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the clothing business for fifteen years, His business has been expanding over time, however his challenges include high rent and trading license charges plus competition. His vision is to open a wholesale business and educate his children to higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell for the season

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for her family. A 39-year-old mother of six children, she lives in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

Ursula’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI, a first Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2009. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. Ursula needs working capital to help boost her business for increased profit making. 

Now, she is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her variety store, to be used to pay for groceries for her enterprise. 

Ursula is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her family and being able to bring them to into a decent way of life. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

loans.use: will be used to pay for groceries for her enterprise

loans.name: Kelly Esther

texts.es: Kelly tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13,11 y 7 años en casa de sus padres ubicado en P.J. Nueva Esperanza, ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de productos de belleza y con sus padres tiene un pequeño negocio de licor que les va muy bien ya que en esa zona es un negocio muy rentable,Kelly con sus ahorros y los de su esposo pudo comprarse una moto taxi la cual maneja su esposo ,el Financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de licor ellos sueñan con poder tener su propio negocio para asi tener un mayor ingreso de dinero y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kelly is 33 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and three children, aged 13, 11 and 7, in her parents' home which is located in Nueva Esperanza new town.

For several years, Kelly has worked selling beauty products and, together with her parents, she has a small liquor business which is doing very well as it is a very profitable business in this area.  With her savings and her husband's savings, Kelly was able to buy a 'mototaxi' (auto rickshaw) which her husband operates.

Kelly will use this loan to buy liquor.  She and her husband dream of owning their own business so that they can make more income and provide their children with a better future.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  Tima faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators.  She hopes to expand in the future.

With the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar and wheat flour.  She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Katanya Development Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Kantanya Development” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org., in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each one in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Hawa T.. Hawa was born in Makom village, 32 years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader, and her children are attending primary school. Hawa has been a small business woman for 4 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy items like soaps, sardines, candles, etc. in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys items like soaps, sardines, candles, etc. in larger quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan B. is from the village of  Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business buying and selling fruit such as bananas and mangoes. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

Susan is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruit such as bananas and rambutan to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
 
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Valiant Women Of Pirayu Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañía Tujukua de la Ciudad de Caacupe que dista a 25 km de la Oficina de Fundación Paraguaya de dicha ciudad.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Maria Antonia D., ella se dedica a la Artesanía en Ñanduti (bordados), la misma vive con su pareja que es empleado (Guardia de Seguridad) y sus tres hijos que son estudiantes, doña Antonia es una persona muy humilde, vive en una casita precaria pero aun así es muy trabajadora y responsable, ella trabaja incansablemente todos los días para poder generar más ingresos en su hogar y así ayudar con los gastos diarios.
Ella destina todo su crédito a la compra de telas e hilos para realizar sus tejidos de ñanduti, gracias al empeño y la dedicación que ella le pone  a su trabajo siempre tiene muchos pedidos y sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.
Ella como todas sus compañeras de comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el importante apoyo que les están brindando con este crédito.
texts.en:
The women of this group are members of "Compania Tujukua" in the cit of Caacupe, located at a distance of 25 km from the offices of Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) in the same city.

The leader of the group is Maria Antonia D.. She is an artisan in Nanduti where she lives with her partner, employed as a security guard, and their three children, all of whom are in school. Antonia is a very humble person and she lives in a small and precarious home but she is very hard working and responsible. She works every day tirelessly to generate more income for her home and to help with the daily expenses.

She will invest all of her loan in the purchase of fabrics and threads to weave Nanduti articles. Thanks to her work and her dedication that she puts into her work she always has many orders and her clients are always very satisfied.

She and her colleagues in the group are very thankful to Fundacion Paraguaya and to Kiva for the important support they are providing them through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is a married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family. She is 54 years old and has two children, aged 19 and 23.

Merita is a rice farmer and hog raiser. She prepares her land well for planting rice crops. She also makes sure the pigs she raises are healthy. Merita sells her rice and pigs to the market. This has been her family's source of income for quite some time now.

Merita's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude, a single 23-year-old, makes a living by selling a variety of goods such as rice, sugar, beans, body lotion, cooking oil and so on. His three-year-old business is well-organized, and he employs one person to help him.

Jean Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a variety of goods including body lotion, beans, and cooking oil to sell. With the additional profits arising from the loan, Jean Claude hopes to continue reinvesting in his business and to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as body lotion, beans, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Sipura

texts.en: Sipura K. is 50 years old and divorced with four children, three of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bread from her bakery and plans to use the requested loan to increase her stock of bread. Her future goal is to buy motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more bread for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and other equipment.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 49 años, es separada  y vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tras años de labor intensa, continua vendiendo artículos y herramientas en su ferretería, establecimiento que tiene desde hace 15 años. En sus inicios, empezó de manera ambulante pero con el paso de los años ha crecido su negocio y ahora tiene un lugar formal. Era lo que siempre quiso y ahora se ha convertido en una serie de satisfacciones en la vida de sus hijos. Las ganancias que obtiene la deriva para el sosteniendo de su casa, considera que su negocio es muy rentable porque los materiales de construcción que vende tiene mucha demanda en su zona, aún a pesar de la competencia, ya que en estos últimos años  se han abierto mas puntos de venta alrededor de su negocio, pero las afronta con una buena atención y ofertando alguno de sus productos. Su prioridad es tener mayor capital de trabajo para ofrecer a su clientela variedad de artículos de ferretería.
