Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, tiene  muchas experiencias de trabajo dentro de su banco comunal que le ha permitido mejorar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old, separated, and lives with her two children in her own home.  After years of hard work, she continues selling goods and tools in her hardware store which she has owned for 15 years.

Initially, Delia made her sales as an itinerant street vendor but, over the years, she has grown her business and now she has formal business premises.  This is what she always wanted and it has fulfilled a series of needs in her children's lives.  She uses the profits that she makes in her business to support her household.  Delia considers her business to be very profitable because the construction supplies that she sells are very much in demand in her area, in spite of the competition.  In recent years, more sales outlets have opened around her business but she faces up to them by providing good customer service and putting some of her products on special offer.  Her priority is having more working capital so that she can offer her customers a good variety of hardware items.

This is Delia's eighth loan from MFP.  She has a lot of experience working as a member of her community bank which has enabled her to improve.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to stock her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and spare parts for sidecar repair for her motorcycle transport business.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. Judith earns more income from food vending (barbecue).

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and spare parts for sidecar repair.

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Femme de 48ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 23ans et 18ans .Elle a commencée en 1978 à vendre les patates douces grillées devant la parcelle de ses parents avec 2500f de fond. Avec la réalité du pays, elle s’est lancé dans le commerce des habits en 2002 et ouvre une boutique avec étalage à la devanture. 

Par jour elle a des recettes de 25.000f minimum et 100.000f maximum, ce troisième prêt va lui permettre d’acheter dans les dépôts de la place deux ballot de tee-shirts, un ballot des pantalons jeans pour enfants, 10 douzaines des chemises mixtes, 5 douzaines des robes pour fillettes, 5 douzaines de culottes pour petits garçons, 10 douzaines  d’ensembles des sous vêtements pour dames ainsi que des sacs à main pour dames.

Elle à pour vision de faire plus de bénéfices et commencer dans la vente en gros, elle est seule à subvenir aux besoins des ses filles, car elle les soutiens dans leurs études ainsi que construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
A 48-year old woman, single and the mother of two (23 and 18 years of age). Back in 1978, she started selling grilled sweet potatoes in front of her parents’ home, with 2500 West African Francs as a starting capital. In view of the developments in her country, in 2002 she went into selling clothes and opened a shop with a stand in front of  her entrance.

Her daily receipts range between 25,000 and 100,000 francs. This third loan will allow her to buy from local wholesalers two bales of t-shirts, one bale of children’s jeans, 10 dozens of various shirts, five dozens of young girl’s dresses, 5 dozens of  boys’ pants, 10 dozens of ladies’ underwear sets as well as ladies’ handbags. Her vision is to increase her income and to start selling wholesale. She is the only one to support her daughters, whom she supports in their studies. She would also like to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bales of T-shirts,  girls' dresses, various shirts etc

loans.name: Khureltogoo

texts.en:
Mr. Khureltogoo, 28, has been a meat salesman in the bazaar since 2008.  He lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in their poor house. His wife is a seamstress in a small factory. 

This family needs a new good house and wants to plant some trees inside their fence. So, the loan Khureltogoo is borrowing will be used to purchase the construction materials and some beautiful trees for the improvement of their life condition.

loans.use: To purchase the construction materials and some beautiful trees for the improvement of their life condition.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 45 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. He is married and has five children between the ages of six and 17. His wife is a farmer and all of their children go to school. Since 2006, Emmanuel has been successfully running a general store. He has made improvements to his store since he opened it and it is now a thriving business that helps support his family. With this loan, Emmanuel will purchase sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, and tomatoes to sell in his store, which will sustain his business. Emmanuel plans to save the profits from his business so he can reinvest and provide for his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, rice, beans, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Silvia Magali

texts.es:
Silvia de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda.  Hace 15 años atrás a trabajado para mejorar la vida de sus hijos a trabajado y a invertido dinero en víveres de primera necesidad para tener una tienda acorde a los requerimientos de sus clientes. 

Trabaja desde las 06h45 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. La hermana le ayuda atender la tienda cuando Silvia sale a comprar mercadería o atender a sus hijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, enlatados, granos, etc. En el futuro quiere seguir con su tienda y que su familia tenga buena salud.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 45, is a hardworking woman who manages a small store. She started working 15 years ago so that she could improve the lives of her children. By working and investing her money in basic necessity products, she has been able to operate a store that meets the requirements of her customers.

Silvia works every day from 6:45am to 10pm. Her sister helps with looking after the store whenever she has to leave to buy merchandise or take care of her children. Silvia has many aspirations for her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy basic necessity products such as rice, canned goods, grain, and other items. In the future, she wants to continue with her store and see her family in good health.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, grain, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a hardworking 34-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is going to school. To make ends meet, he has been operating a pharmacy. He wants in the next five years to be financially stable and his business stabilized. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy medicine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Rosithel

texts.en:
Rosithel is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. She runs a general store to help her husband earn income. Due to the high cost of commodities, she wants to improve her business to increase her income and satisfy their family needs and finance the education of their children. 

She wants to ask for a loan of P6,000 to buy additional stocks of fruit, beverages, soft drinks, breads, snack foods and candies to sell in the village. She hopes that the loan will help a lot to make her business grow and become viable through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruit, beverages, soft drinks, bread, snack foods and candies to sell in the village.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. She is 48 years old, married to Samuel and they have two children who go to school.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Nancy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Adriel

texts.es: Adriel, de 63 años, es un hombre muy alegre y responsable, él convive con su pareja con quien tiene siete hijos mayores, quienes ya son adultos e independientes. Juntos habitan en la casa que heredó de sus padres, acompañadps de sus hermanos. El trabajo de Adriel, es el de servicio de vulcanizado a las mototaxis y motos que a diario van en busca que les de solución los problemas de su llanta. Por otro lado tiene una pequeña tienda de venta respetos de vehículos. Ambos negocios se encuentran instalados en un espacio de su casa, y tiene 20 años ejecutando haciendo lo mismo y con ello logró educar y alimentar a sus hijos, y dos de ellos con este mismo trabajo pero en distintos lugares. La ventaja que tiene su negocio es que su taller se encuentra en un calle muy concurrida de la ciudad. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, y espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar trabajando en su taller. Con el monto solicitado, comprará repuestos para la venta de algunos materiales y repuestos para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Adriel, 63, is a very cheerful, responsible man.   He lives with his spouse and has six older children who are all adults and independent.  They live together in a house he inherited from his parents with his siblings. 

Ariel’s work is repairing mototaxi and motorcycle tires for customers who daily come by seeking solutions to their tire related problems.  On the other hand, he also has a small vehicle spare parts store.  Both businesses are located in a space in his house.  He has been doing the same thing for 20 years and he managed to educate and feed his children through it; two of them have the same kind of business but in other parts of town.  The advantage that his shop has is that it’s located on a very busy street in the city.

This will be his first MFP loan and he hopes to get support from each one of you to stay in business in his shop.  He will use the requested amount to by replacement parts to sell and some materials and spare parts to stock his workshop.

loans.use: to buy materials and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cosmetics, articles for the home, school and high school supplies, gifts, skin lotions, and perfumes.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. 

He started his own business working as a floor covering laborer almost three years ago. He has nine years of experience working in the same occupation. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. 

Despite his situation, he feels positive about his business potential for the coming year. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a paving cutter machine and renew his business tools. In the future, he hopes to start working directly with multiple construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a paving cutter machine and renew his business tools.

loans.name: Silvera

texts.en:
Silvera is a 33-year-old married woman with six children age between 8 and 13. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Silvera has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells canned goods, shampoo, soap and other items. She also helps her husband sell rice. 

Silvera has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as noodles and canned goods. Silvera hopes for her store to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is a married man with two children. Roberto is 33 years old and he lives in the Philippines. Roberto owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for four years. Each month, he earns 6,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase fishing materials. Roberto has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Roberto wants to build a house and for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Lindana W / G Group

texts.en:
Selina takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Selina had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Selina was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Selina will invest in livestock rearing and buy more land to allow saving for future use.

Selina is the facilitator of the Lindana W/G group. She is in the photograph with her group members. Selina and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Lindana W/G group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Selina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens, plus care and housing construction for the chickens.

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en:
Dindo is a brave and painstaking man. He endures all hardships encountered in his life. It serves as a challenge for him to provide a good education for his three children whom are still in elementary grade. Aside from corn farming, he also serves his community as a Barangay Council at Estefania. In farming, he pours out all his experiences and farming practices. He has been in this field for five years. He plants and harvest corn upon maturity and his wife budgets it well for all his family's daily consumption. According to him, it was just enough to cover all their expenses. 

Dindo now lacks capital to buy corn seeds and fertilizers so he decided to borrow loan of P25,000 to buy his inputs. 

Someday, Dindo aims to earn a consistent profit from his corn farming business and lift his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and the fertilizers he uses in farming.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo es artesano costurero; confecciona ropa y hace reparaciones en general. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial. Pablo es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Luís de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta será la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is a sewing artisan who produces clothing and makes general alterations. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine. Pablo is married and has one child. He lives at the home of his in-laws in the District of San Luís in the city of El Alto.

This is the second time that his loan request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is married and supports her family financially by operating a dairy business. She sells milk to people in her community for a reasonable price.

Razia is very efficient and also performs her household tasks very well along with her business.  She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are very young and are not of school going age yet.  Her husband is a mason and constructs buildings and houses on order. He is known in his area for his skills and earns reasonably good profits.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner Asasah to fund her dairy business. She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy another buffalo that will allow her to get larger quantities of milk and increase her income by selling it at a profit.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Razia is the woman holding the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Fredy Fernando

texts.es:
el señor Fredy Fernando  es soltero, tiene 20 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica al comercio a la venta de calzados, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, tiene 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería, ya que entre mas productos cuenta, mejores  ventas realiza y obtiene mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Fredy Fernando, 20, is single; he never attended school.  He is a merchant; he sells shoes.  He has the support of his parents and has three years’ experience.  He’s asking for a loan that he’ll use to buy more merchandise since the more products he has on hand, the better sales he’ll have and obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Kishimkan

texts.ru: Кишимкан 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Кишимкан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Кишимкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 10 овец. На 2,22 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кишимкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров с телятами для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кишимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбы ее детей.
texts.en: Saliymbabu is 39 years old, married and together with her husband is raising 2 children. Saliymbabu has a specialized secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, Saliymbabu is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business 5 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Saliymbabu's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 25 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Saliymbabu requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows in order to increase her livestock headcount. Saliymbabu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and plans to save money to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy two cows with calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 28 years old. She is married with 4 children. 

She has had a posho mill and been selling maize flour for 5 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase bags of maize and hopes this will help her expand the business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children successfully.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to help her expand the business.

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.en:
My name is Edwin, I sell pillows, T-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing. I have had my business for 3 years, and it is visited by loyal clientel because I have fair prices. My business generates an income that covers family expenses. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to sell a higher variety of clothes and the profits I make I will use to build a house, because we are currently renting.

Loan Use: Purchase blouses, T-shirts, pillows, clothing hooks, pocketbooks.

Mi nombre es Edwin, me dedico a la venta almohadas, camisetas, camisas, y ropa de niño, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años, el que es visitados por clientes fijos que tengo ya que les brindo buenos precios, mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia. mi meta es incrementar el inventario y poder vender ropa variada y con las ganancias que obtenga construir mi casa, ya que actualmente alquilamos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, camisetas, almohadas, ganchos de ropa, bolsas.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida was born in 1989 and lives in a household of 3 in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Before, Khalida's husband had a cosmetics cart and sold cosmetics materials but due to problems he decided that his wife should take a loan from AFSG to start a new business, a wood shop, because selling wood in the bazaar carries higher benefits than the cosmetics cart.

Khalida thinks that if she is a good client for AFSG, she can take a 3rd loan cycle for herself. She would buy a new machine and table so that she can sew more clothes which her son can then sell in the bazaar. With this business she is able to contribute to her family's income.

loans.use: Buying wood, axes, and a car

loans.name: Czarina

texts.en: Czarina is 60 years old lives with 5 members of her family in district 3 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She took a loan out for her son who is a shopkeeper that sells sickle. She is in her cycle 3 of the loan and her son will use the loan to buy more sickle to sell, and some kits to fix the sickles.She wants to take another loan out to increase the business of  sickle shop, to enlarge the shop, and to solve all the economical problems of his family.

loans.use: Expand sickle shop with repair kits, and more sickles.

loans.name: Phe

texts.en: Mrs. Phe S. is 31 years old and rents a small stall in a market in Kampong Cham, selling lemon pickles.  She earns about $2/day in her business, and her husband earns $4/day as a horse cart driver.  This combined income is just enough for Mrs. Phe S. and her husband to support their 2 children.  She will use this loan to purchase more lemons and to pay rent for her stall.  She hopes to purchase a motorbike or car in the future so that she can transport her unique food to other markets around Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase lemons and pay for stall rental at the market

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn married in 1995 and has 2 children. She learned to weave silk in 1994 from her neighbor and started making silk that same year. Her husband is a construction worker in local communities. In addition, the family also grows rice.

Sokhorn has already borrowed and repaid two loans from MAXIMA. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300. She will use this loan to buy silk material and sewing thread, and to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom so that she can continue to expand her silk production.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread, and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E. is 42 years old and the married mother of five children. She’s one of the active members of LAPO.

She has run a clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry business for four years. She wants to restock her shop for Christmas trade, so she is requesting $800 in order to purchase more clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry for sales. She lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags & jewelry

loans.name: Jaime Fernando

texts.pt:
Jaime Fernando H. is 27 years old, he lives with his wife and 2 children. He joined the credit program in June 2007, and his first loan was of 6.000mt. He sells feed in the Xiquelene market in Maputo. Jaime is requesting a loan of 12.000mt to be repaid in 5 months. He wants to increase his inventory and build a place to store his product.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Jaime Fernando H. tem 27 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 2 filhos. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT.Vende uma variedade de rações em sacos e em canecas no mercado de Xiquelene em Maputo.Vai tomar 12.000MT para pagar em 5 meses com vista a aumentar o stock de ração uma vez que está a construir um depósito para comprar ração em grandes quantidades.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Rajamoh

texts.ru:
Rajamoh F. is 43 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 5 children. Rajamoh is a homemaker and also raises livestock for resale. She will use her loan to purchase livestock and feed. Every 40-45 days she will sell the livestock and will use her revenues to purchase additional livestock. She will use her profits to support her family and to increase their standard of living.

Rajamoh will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Факирова Раджамох, возраст 43 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Так как Раджамох домохозяйка она занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота для дальнейшей его продажи. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести крупный рогатый скот и корма для его продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней она будет продавать откормленный скот и на вырученные деньги приобретать молодой скот. Полученную прибыль от продажи скота она будет использовать для содержание семьи и улучшения своего жизненного уровня. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of livestock

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Muzafar R., who is 32 years old, has a high school education, is married, and has 3 children. Muzafar is in the business of breeding and selling cattle. He has been doing this for the past 8 years. Using the obtained loan he plans to purchase additional cattle. Every 40-45 days, he plans to sell them and using the profits immediately buy more young bulls. He plans to use the proceeds to pay off the loan and to support his family. Muzafar will be paying off the loan during the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимов Музаффар, возраст – 32 года, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Музафар занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 8 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение крупного рогатого скота. Через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует продавать скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать молодых бычков для откормки. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать для погашения кредита и на одержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en:
I am Zohra M. from the mid-sized city Faisalabad. I was married 22 years ago and I have three boys and three girls. All of my children attend school, except one who is currently working. My husband is a retired army officer. I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients and I now want to expand my stitching business. My loan group members are: Rahat B., whose husband trades livestock; Nasreen B., who will use her share of loan to pay off the remaining installments on their cow; Rehana M., who will buy a rickshaw for her husband; and Shakoran S., who requires this loan for her brother who sells fruit. This loan group has been together for one year and has shown a great sense of responsibility.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand stitching business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a very hard-working widow with 6 children and 2 dependents. She is 51 years old and sells charcoal, firewood, and dry fish from her home, where she conducts her 8-month-old business. She only changed businesses from piggery after her pigs fell sick and died without proper medication, but with this loan, she intends to reintroduce it in her business, after attaining proper training; she has high hopes that such a disaster will not occur again.

loans.use: With this loan, Christine intends to buy pigs and their feed, as an addition to her charcoal, firewood, and dry-fish businesses, in order to increase her savings.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo L. is 26 years old. She lives with her husband Pin Han in Chrey Choeung Village, Siem Reap Province. L. earns about $10 per day from selling clothes and sewing. Han is a 28-year-old who earns $4 a day breeding pigs. They request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. This loan will help expand their business and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell for the business.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
Born November 26, 1979 in Cotonou, Mrs. Yvette F. is married and mother of four children for whom she is still responsible. Selling rice and beans in a private primary school in her neighborhood, she brings in an average of 15,000 francs (about US$ 36) a day. She would like to sell more rice and beans, sauces and pastas. Since the enrollment of the school has grown and a great many students spend their afternoons at school where there is still no cafeteria, she would like to expand her business. She is therefore requesting this loan so that she can better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 26 novembre 1979 à COTONOU, dame F. Yvette est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous encore à sa charge. Vendeuse de riz et du haricot dans une école primaire privée de son quartier, elle réalise un chiffre d’affaire total de 15 000 francs en moyenne par jour. Elle souhaite vendre en plus du riz et du haricot, de la sauce et de la pâte. En raison de l’augmentation de l’effectif de cette école et du nombre impressionnant d’élèves qui passe leur après midi dans l’école qui ne dispose pas encore d’une de restauration, elle voudrait élargir son activité. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 50 liters of peanut oil, 1 bag of rice, 2 bags of corn, various condiments, and 1 bag of dried beans

Achat de 50 litres d’huile d’arachide, 1 sac de riz, 2 sacs de maïs, divers condiments et 1 sac de haricot.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry R., 58, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her six children. She rides her bike around Phsar Skun market every day, selling secondhand clothes for a US$2 income. She is also supported by two of her daughters who work in garment factories. She has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase her own stand inside the market to sell her secondhand clothes. She believes that her bicycle is not the best way to reach customers and she needs the exposure that a stand can provide. She believes this investment will allow her to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a stand in the market

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia started her own business out of financial necessity. One of her children needed medical treatment because she was born with a medical condition, but the treatment was too expensive. On top of that, she needed to pay the household expenses. At that time, since she was not able to get a job, she decided to open up a beauty salon because she had experience in cutting, styling, and dyeing hair. Thanks to this business, she has been able to raise her two children.

She needs a loan of $800.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase beauty salon furniture that she needs for manicures and acrylic nails.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia inicio el negocio por necesidades económicas esto fue que los tratamientos que necesitaba uno de sus hijos por que nació delicada de salud eran muy caros, además que necesitaba pagar sola los gastos de su casa, en ese momento porque no podía conseguir trabajo y teniendo la experiencia de cortes, peinados, tintes etc. decidió poner su negocio. Gracias a este ha podido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar muebles que necesita para la aplicación de uñas acrílicas.

loans.use: Purchase beauty salon furniture

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Small business entrepreneur Francisco José B. is a native of the city of Bluefields, is 49 years old, is married to Mrs. María del Socorro Urbina,  and together they have 3 children.  The only income that the entrepreneur has is that of his business.  Mr. B. has been a distributor of basic food staples and dairy products for 11 years.  He offers beans, cheese, and yuca and malanga root, among other things, having as clients owners of general stores that prefer him because he offers a variety of products.  This is the second loan for this small business entrepreneur.  It should be noted that the demand for the products that he sells has not diminished since they are widely consumed by the population.  Right now he needs to buy:  five 100 lb. bags of beans at US$50.00 per bag, and three 100 lb. blocks of cheese at US$120.00 per block.  With this investment, he will be able to meet the ever-increasing demands of his clients.

 Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El  Microempresario  Francisco José B. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tienen 49 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. María del Socorro Urbina, ambos tienen 3 hijos. El único ingreso que tiene el  microempresario es el de su negocio. El  Sr. B. es distribuidor de productos básicos  y lácteos hace  11  años donde ofrece (frijoles, queso, yuca, malanga entre otras cosas) teniendo como clientes a los propietarios de las pulperías que lo prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. Este es el segundo crédito del microempresario. Cabe destacar que los productos que el oferta no han disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 5 quintales de Frijoles a $ 50.00 dólares el quintal y  3 quintales de queso a $ 120.00 dólares el quintal con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To buy beans and cheese

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 52 años. ElL. desD. hace algunos años se dedica a L. confección D. prendas D. vestir, en el pequeño taller que ha puesto en su casa. 

Lidia se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio D. confección D. ropa. Su hija menor le ayuda cuando tiene algo D. tiempo, ya que elL. está estudiando en una universidad pública.

Con el préstamo que anteriormente recibió Lidia pudo comprar telas e hilos para confeccionar L. ropa que elL. venD..

A elL. le gustaría comprar un carrito sanguchero, así elL. podría vender comida por las noches en L. puerta D. su casa, y tener algo más D. ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is 52 years old. For some years she has maD. clothing in a small workshop she has in her home.

Lidia works full time in her business making clothing. Her youngest daughter helps her when she has a bit of time, since she is studying in a public university.

With a prior loan Lidia was able to buy fabric and thread to make the clothing she sells.

She would like to buy a vending cart so that she can sell food at night from her front door and have more income for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vending cart for selling food.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Tumain M.from Mbeya. She is married with two children aged 2 and 5. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents who are orphans. Tumain has been running a grocery store since 2005. Her business is selling commodities such as rice, cooking oil, soda, etc. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Tumaini currently earns about $30USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $175USD in order to buy additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda. In the future, she plans to expand the business. Tumaini thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Tumaini would like to buy additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dajana

texts.en: Dajana was born in 1987 and she lives in Doboj, a town in Bosnia.  At 21, she is unmarried and lives with her parents and sister.  She works as a financial analyst at the local train station, but she earns only 450KM/month, the equivalent of roughly $300 USD/month.  To supplement her income, Dajana sells cosmetics and offers manicures from inside her home.  She requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women, International, with which she will buy supplies and equipment to offer more upscale manicures.  She hopes that the investment will show that her business is professional, and will attract more clients.  She does not want to run a beauty shop for the rest of her life, but says that this is a necessary business for her to support herself in the short term.

loans.use: To buy manicure supplies.

loans.name: Jose Ervey

texts.es: El señor José Ervey es una persona pensionada, pero cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hija, están solicitando el crédito para la construcción de una barda y colocación de un portón para protección y seguridad de ellos mismos.
texts.en:
José Ervey is a pensioner and has the support of his wife and daughter. They are requesting a loan to build a fence and install a gate for their own safety and security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence and installation of a gate

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta empresaria Señora Yamileth del Carmen M. González, tiene la edad de 25 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Yamileth tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 8 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su otro hijo de 10 años cursa recientemente el 6 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como sub.-oficial de la policía nacional, sus propósitos son de trabajar siempre para llevar siempre el sustento para su familia para sobrellevar la situación sus sueños son de establecer un tienda de ropa en su casa de habitación donde ofrezca una variedad de productos con el fin de suplir cada una de las necesidades de sus clientes sus deseos son  de obtener su propia casa ya que en la que viven actualmente es en la casa de su Mama y  que Dios le proporcione mas vida para seguir ayudando a sus hijos para salir adelante para que estos sean unos profesionales para el día de mañana y no les falte el sustento de diario.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es venta de ropa por encargo como lo es: shorts, ropa interior, pantalones y camisetas, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante ya que tiene que ofrecer de casa en casa el producto, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, ella inicia este negocio con una venta de refrescos y llamadas telefónicos pero este negocio no proporciono mucha ganancia por lo que decide mantenerlo como otra fuente de ingresos ya que por influencias de una amiga quien le dio la idea de ofertar la ropa por encargo ya que este es una negocio con rentabilidad y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en su negocio hasta que logro este fuera su fuente de ingresos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa y otros encargos por lo que agradece a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que colaboran para mejorar el estado económico de las personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
The businesswoman Yamileth del Carmen M. González is 25 years old, is married, and has two children. Her older son is 10 years old and recently enrolled in the sixth grade of primary school, and her younger son is 8 years old and in the fourth grade of primary school. Her husband works as a sub-official of the national police. Her goals are to always work to support her family and improve their situation. Her dream is to establish her own clothing store in her home, where she can offer a variety of products and meet the needs of her clients. She hopes to one day own her own home, as her family currently lives in her mother's house. She also hopes that God will grant her a long life so she can continue helping her children to move forward, pursue professional careers in the future, and be able to meet their daily needs. Yamileth works selling clothing such as shorts, underwear, trousers and shirts. She offers the clothing door to door, taking orders for the items, and has owned this business for 3 years. She first started out selling soft drinks and phone cards, but this activity was not very profitable. A friend suggested that she start selling clothing as this is a profitable activity, and little by little she invested money in this business until it became her main source of income. This loan is for working capital as she needs to purchase shoes, perfume, clothes and other orders. She is thankful to Fundación León 2000 and its partner organizations for improving the economic situation of the people who need their support.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en: Mrs. Rosamie A. is 19 years old, married and a resident of Danao Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Since she married at an early age, she had to help her husband with his business.  He catches fish to be sold to the public market or neighbors. They have been on this business for a year, and they decided to acquire additional fishing boats and fishing nets. They agreed to join Paglaum MPC last July 31, 2007, where they have used the financial services and other benefits such as insurance and savings deposit.  They request a loan for $325.  She hopes that their business will be successful so they can send their child to school.

loans.use: To acquire a fishing boat

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
N. Edith is the chairperson of the woman's group in Nakawuka. Edith has a stall at home where she sells firewood, cabbage, tomatoes etc. She has had the business for 9 years. Apart from the stall, she is a worker at a local shop, where she works from 8am to 1pm. By investing in her stall business she has been able to create profits that helps pay for her school feels, childrens' clothes, and their well-being. She says her business has been successful because of her friendly nature and work ethic. 

Edith is a widow with 8 children, out of which 2 are out of school. She has a dream of seeing all her kids go to school. (In the photo is Grace, the Coordinator)

loans.use: Vegetables to be sold at her home stall.

loans.name: Thi Dao

texts.vi: Chị Bùi Thị Đảo  năm nay 45  tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2006. Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều chăn nuôi bò và trồng trọt tại nhà. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chính cho gia đình chị với mức thu nhập 1.500.000/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bò giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. B. Thi Dao, 45 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. Currently, she and her husband both rear cattle and grow vegetables at home. This is also the main source of income for her family. Their monthly income is about 1.5 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 9 millions VND to purchase animal feeds and more cows to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cows

loans.name: Kelenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kelenya est composé de huit  femmes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de TINGOLE, sous préfecture de FANA de la préfecture de DIOÏLA, région de KOULIKORO république du Mali.
 Par des liens de voisinage, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires
Dans l’intention d’élargir la taille de leur activité elles ont adhéré à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et  sont à leur septième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Les précédents prêts ont été bien remboursés.
 Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent acheter 150 kg de choux, 200 kg d’aubergines, 200 kg de sel de cuisine et une importante quantité de divers  condiments. Une partie des produits sera achetée sur le marché de FANA et l’autre partie avec les jardiniers de TINGOLE et environs pour être ensuite revendu sur le marché locale de TINGOLE. Les condiments seront vendus au comptant et en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes. 
Les femmes du groupe Kelenya comptent obtenir chacune,  avec ce prêt un bénéfice par cycle de 15.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans leur activité pour augmenter le chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
The Kelenya group is composed of 8 married women who have an average age of 28 and on average, 3 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingole, Sous-prefecture of Fana, Prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

Due to their being neighbors, these women met; they all sell condiments. With the intention of expanding their businesses, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 7th loan of which four were agricultural loans. The preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan, these women intend to buy 150 kg of cabbages, 200 kg of eggplant, 200 kg of cooking salt, and a large quantity of various condiments. Some of the products will be bought at the market in Fana, and the rest from the market gardeners of Tingole and its environs; they will be sold at the local market of Tingole. The condiments will be sold for cash, retail, to a clientele composed of women.

Each of the women of the Kelenya group expects to make a profit during this loan cycle of 15,000 F CFA which will be used in their businesses to raise their earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments

loans.name: Rahmatkul

texts.ru: Рахматкулу 56 лет. У него есть жена и 4-ро детей. Три сына и одна дочь. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Единственная дочь помогает по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Рахматкул пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он давно уже кредитуется в нашей организации, и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en:
Rahmatkul is 56 years old. He is married and has four children -- three sons and one daughter. His eldest sons are in Russia working, where they send back remittances to their parents. The parents save the remittances so that they can later be spent on the sons' weddings. Their only daughter helps in the house. The wife processes yarns -- and sells it herself at the market. And Rahmatkul raises cattle in the mountains during the day and returns late in the evenings. He has been borrowing from Kiva for some time now, and has always been a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of livestock

loans.name: Catherina

texts.en: Catherina is a widow and has six children who are currently working. She is a 63 year-old business woman. She started trading forty years ago and she enjoys selling goods. She trades in clothing materials. Catherina believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in Kasoa market. She believes the loan would provide her with greater capital to purchase more stock of clothing materials to serve her customers. Catherina belongs to the community group called Jonathan Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing materials.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad y 1 hijo. Posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió como capital adicional.

Debido a la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de  mercadería variada (arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, conservas, aceites, mantequilla, conservas, etc.), esto le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to Rio Desaguadero Communal Bank located in the district of Desaguadero of the Chucuito province in the state of Puno. She is 24 years old and has one child. She did not finish high school (12th grade). Lidia has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past four years and started her general store with an initial loan of 300 soles, money used to invest in additional working capital. Due to the demand of her customers, she now requires a loan of 2,500 soles to be able to purchase a variety of merchandise (rice, sugar, pasta, canned goods, cooking oil, butter, etc.) so she can increase her earnings and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta, canned goods, cooking oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en: Marusya T. is a widow who lives with her youngest son, who is 13 years old, in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She runs a small retail business selling dairy products, largely unprocessed milk, cheese, curds and other items. She has run her business since 1995, buying unprocessed milk and milk products from local herders and selling them for a profit in the local market. Since starting in 1995, her business capital has increased from 50,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). With this profit, she was able to finance her sons' weddings. In the future, she would like to repair her apartment. She is applying for this loan to buy more milk and milk products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy dairy products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Étoile sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’habits  pour enfants, des fruits, de bois de chauffe et  de boissons.  
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin croissant de la clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les  deux précédents  se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 colis d’habits pour enfants,  30 chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe, 100 régimes de bananes et 20 casiers de boisson. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Hamdallaye de façon ambulante, dans le quartier et au  grand marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne.
Certaines femmes du groupe Étoile ambitionnent  devenir des grossistes  et d’autres  devenir des clientes individuelles.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Étoile are all married and average 35 years of age and have four children. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of Mali). The women run diverse businesses, including the sale of children's clothing, fruit, firewood, and beverages. With the goal of satisfying the growing customer need, the group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. The two preceding loans have been settled. With this new loan, they intend to buy 10 packages of children's clothing, 30 cart loads of firewood, 100 bunches of bananas, and 20 cases of drinks. Supplies are gotten at the grand market of Sikasso City. The merchandise is sold mostly in cash transactions at the Hamdallaye market in an itinerant manner in the area and also at the grand market. The customers are composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 13,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used for the health of the children, and the other part will be put into savings. Certain women in the group have the ambition of becoming wholesalers, and the others, becoming individual loan customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam T. is 38 years old and has two school-aged children. He currently owns a motorbike that he uses to transport passengers in the community for a fee. His wife stays at home to operate a little business, selling grocery goods to the neighbors. She also takes care of the couple's children and the household. 
As of a little while ago, Sam's income has started to decline due to the breakdown of his motorcycle. Sam is therefore now requesting a loan of US$400 to be able to purchase and install a new motor.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor for a motorbike

loans.name: Tuwesawa Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is a member of Tuwesawa borrower group. She is 30 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 15, 12, and 5 years.

Mgeni started her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000.

This is Mgeni's second loan from BRAC. She requested the amount of 300,000 in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she makes from the use of this loan, Mgeni hopes to save money and expand her business. Yetu is the other member of the same borrower group. She also requested a loan from BRAC in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo is 50 years old and is married with three children. Currently all his children are in school.

Kwadwo runs a chemist (pharmacy) and sells various kinds of drugs in his neighborhood like blood-tonics, pain-killers, malaria drugs, etc. He has been in business for fifteen years now and he is the only person who supplies pharmaceutical products in the community. His pharmacy is registered to operate by the Ghana Pharmacy Council.

Kwadwo wants to use the loan to buy an increased supply of drugs and to include items that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to raise a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy an increased supply of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzouwe, Mbeya. She is 30 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children  are 18 and 14 years old. she also cares for  other 2 dependents.

Hilda has owned a cafe business selling food for  4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Hilda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities for her cafe business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Hilda hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for  her  cafe business

loans.name: Ma.emma Florenda

texts.en:
Ma.emma Florenda J. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Ma.emma Florenda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma.emma Florenda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ma.emma Florenda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Ma.emma Florenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma.emma Florenda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma.emma Florenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Léonard

texts.fr: H. Léonard est né en 1973 à Abomey, une ville historique du Bénin. Marié, Léonard n’a pas encore d’enfant. Léonard a appris pendant trois ans la coiffure pour femme et l'exerce depuis près de quinze ans à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léonard dispose d’un atelier au marché du quartier VEDOKO size à Cotonou. C'est pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et s’approvisionner en divers produits cosmétiques (shampooing, balsam, gel, produits défrisants et d'entretien des cheveux, etc.) que Léonard sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de divers produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 38 years old and a mother to two children.  She is married to Raul who is engaged in selling fishballs (a popular snack food made of fish and flour paste molded into balls and deep-fried before serving) and doing some carpentry jobs.  Anabelle helps her husband in selling fishballs.  She helps her husband in finding source of income for their family. At times, when she has extra time she would offer housekeeping service or work as a part-time saleslady for additional income of the family.

Anabelle is already five years into her business. Her business is very important to her because it helps her in meeting the family’s expenditures. Anabelle wants to continue her business until her children finish their education. She is now asking for a loan of PHP15,000 that she needed for the improvement of her vending business.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al L. is 28 years old and single. He is living in the peaceful place of Barangay San Roque Enrile, Cagayan, together with his parents and siblings. He has been operating a sari-sari store business (community-based variety store) in their village for four years. He is also engaged in the rice-retailing business as another source of income to help provide the needs of his parents.

He wants his business to grow, for it is a great help in meeting the needs of his family. He is able to assist his parents by earning an income that is being utilized for the daily allowances of his siblings, who are attending school. He wants to borrow additional capital for his business because he needs more merchandise, such as rice, biscuits, canned goods and soft drinks, for the improvement of his store. He is in need of 7,000 PHP, and this will be used to buy more goods to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes that Kiva lenders will consider his request.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida A. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more items such as bags of salt and boxes of soap to sell.

Saida is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase items such as bags of salt and boxes of soap to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells wholesale and retail drinks.  She has been running the business since 2007. She is married with two children and she is 45 years-old. Her husband sells granite, gravel and sand. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She has been with Kiva partner LAPO for two years now and is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 to expand her business by purchasing more drinks to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase drinks.

loans.name: Lindon Ismael

texts.es: El Sr. Lindon,   es un cliente nuevo que vive junto a su esposa Julia y su hija en un terreno que les  otorgaron sus suegros ubicada en la calle 4 , el señor T. trabaja como transportista propietario en la linea de trufis y esta solicitando este credito para terminar la compra de una cama elastica (juego infantil),  el destino del credito ayudara a la familia a iniciarse en el negocio de juegos para niños, ya que la familia politica de Lindon tiene un negocio de juegos inflables para niños que hasta el momento les genera buenos ingresos y es por este motivo que Lindon y Julia decidieron comprarle la cama elastica para emprender este nuevo negocio y generar mas ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Lindon is a new client. He lives with his wife, Julia, and his daughter on land that his in-laws gave them. It is located on street four. Señor T. works as the owner driver for the Trufis line. He is asking for this loan to finish buying a trampoline. The loan will help his family start in the business of toys for children. Lindon’s in-laws have a business of inflatable toys for children, and it generates good income. That is why Lindon and Julia decided to buy a trampoline to undertake this new business and generate more income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a trampoline

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es:
María Aurelia tiene 49 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito D. la Unión, provincia D. Piura en la región del mismo nombre ubicada a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo

DesD. hace más D. 15 años se dedica a la comercialización D. carnes rojas, D. pescado y D. pollo en el mercadp del caserío Casa GranD., en el distrito D. La Arena. Este negocio constituye la unica fuente D. ingreso con la que saca adelante a su familia por lo que ella se esfuerza todos los dias para sacarlo adelante.

Maria Aurelia se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. carne D. pescado para mantener su negocio ya que durante estos meses el precio D. este producto sube en la región donD. vive.

Ella es una mujer responsable, amable y muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su más granD. anhelo es ver a sus menores hijos convertidos en unos profesionales D. éxito.
texts.en:
María Aurelia is a widow; she is 49 years and lives with her two children in the district of Unión, located in Piura Province of the Piura Region, three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 15 years she has sold red meat, fish and chicken at the market in the Casa GranD. settlement, in the district of La Arena. The business is the only income her family counts on to get ahead; therefore, she labors every day to improve it. This is the first time María Aurelia has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. In order to keep her business going well, she requests 500 new soles to invest in fish, as the price of this product has been going up in the area where she lives. María Aurelia is a responsible person, kind and very dedicated to her family and her work. Her greatest wish is that her children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Dionisia es casada, tiene 68 años y solo 1 de sus hijos viven con ella, Dionisia se dedica a la compra y venta de cochinilla, tara. Además Dionisia se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, cebada.
Dionisia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cochinilla y tara.
El sueño de Dionisia es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisia, 68, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Dionisia is married; only one of her children still lives with her. She sells cochineal and tara (a pod used in eco tanning). In addition, Dionisia farms corn and barley. Dionisia needs 1250 soles to buy cochineal and tara. Dionisia's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de cochinilla y tara. To buy cochineal and tara (eco tanning is obtained from the grinding of the tara pod, harvested from bush. Tara is mainly grown in the higlands of Perú)

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tom S. is a tailor in her village and her husband, Mr. Sat Hai, is a real estate broker. This family has a problem because their sewing machine is too old to use, but they do not have enough money to buy a new one. Thus, in order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Tom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new sewing machine to use instead of the old one. She is the mother of two children who are attending the local public school.

This group consists of five people who all live in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. Mrs. Tom S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use their loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Eulogia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Eulogia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eulogia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Eulogia son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa con material noble.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. She lives with her life partner, is 40 years old, and has two children. Eulogia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and meats every day. Eulogia needs a 900 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Eulogia's dream is to enlarge her store and to build her house with substantial materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica O. is 37 years of age. She sells charcoal and textiles to earn a living.  She uses some of her business profits to support her family and pay wages to her one employee. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the training they offered her, since she has acquired customer care skills. She believes that loyalty and commitment are what leads a person to a successful life. She has requested for a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy charcoal and fabric for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal and fabric for sale

loans.name: Ma. Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Her eldest child is now aged 20 and is off to college. She prays to God that she will be able to sustain all her children’s education.
Margie bakes delicacies and sells them in her community. She dreams of having her own bakery shop someday. She has requested 14,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI, and plans to use it to buy flour, sugar and other baking needs. This loan will truly help Margie reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other baking needs

loans.name: Juanita  Auxiliadora

texts.es: LA SEÑORA H. TUBOS UNOS PERCANCE EN SU VIVIENDA Y COMO VIENE EL INVIERNO TENIA QUE COMPRAR TEJAS PARA EL TECHO DE SUCASA YA QUE QUERIA ASEGURARLA YA QUE TIENE A SU MAMA ENFERMA Y QUIERE ACONDICIONARLE.
texts.en:
LA SEÑORA H. TUBOS UNOS PERCANCE EN SU VIVIENDA Y COMO VIENE EL INVIERNO TENIA QUE COMPRAR TEJAS PARA EL TECHO DE SUCASA YA QUE QUERIA ASEGURARLA YA QUE TIENE A SU MAMA ENFERMA Y QUIERE ACONDICIONARLE.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: GASTOS DEL HOGAR, COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia has made a living as a wheat farmer for the last 10 years.  He is 32 years old, married to Esther Lemurt and has four children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and is now applying for his first loan, which he will use to rent a tractor to prepare his land for a new crop. Zacharia hopes to have his own tractor in the future, and increase his income by renting it out.

loans.use: To rent a tractor to prepare his land for a new wheat crop.

loans.name: Lucrecia Evangelina

texts.es:
Lucrecia G.  se dedica a realizar ropa artesanal y bordados actividad que desempaña desde hace cinco años. En sus inicios según comento realizaba media docena de batas las cuales vendía en el mercado de Masaya  pero poco a poco con el trabajo arduo  en familia y los préstamos  su negocio  creció. 
Actualmente distribuye su línea de ropa en Managua, Catarina, Masaya, Granada, León  Jinotepe y  tiene su propia tienda en el mirador de Catarina meta que tenia y que cumplió gracias al crédito y al apoyo de sus cuatro hijos de 21, 20, 19 y 17 años los cuales estudian  y  en sus tiempos libres trabajan junto con ella.
G. invertirá el crédito en telas, hilos, cintas y otro tipo de materia prima para confeccionar sus modelos un ejemplo de su trabajo es el que muestra en la foto.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Gonzalez has been making clothes and embroidery for five years. She tells us that she started with a half dozen robes, which she sold in the Masaya market. Little by little her business grew with the family’s hard work and the loans. She currently distributes her line of clothing in Managua, Catarina, Masaya, Granada, León, and Jinotepe. She has her own store in Mirador de Catarina. This was her goal, and she achieved it thanks to the loan and the support of her four children. They are 21, 20, 19, and 17. They go to school, and they work with her during their free time. Lucrecia will use the loan to by fabric, thread, ribbons, and other types of materials to make her designs. An example of her work is shown in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrics and thread, etc.

loans.name: Teodorico

texts.en:
Teodorico G. is from the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. He is 56 years old. Teodorico is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Teodorico owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teodorico has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP every cropping.

In 2009, Teodorico joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodorico is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Teodorico from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa S. is from the village of  Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Ma. Luisa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Luisa owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Ma. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Luisa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma. Luisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es:
El señor Alvaro Jose P. V. tiene la edad de 32 años, es casado y su esposa labora como cajero, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, gracias al apoyo y esfuerzo de su esposa lograron instalar una pequeña pulpería en donde venden abarrotes, lácteos, productos para uso personal y domestico.

Es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo ara la compra de un mayor inventario de productos que le permitan incrementar  sus ventas, y favorecer a la economía de la familia en la incursión de nuevos proyectos o fuentes de ingreso para el bienestar continuo de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con los fondos Kiva, ellos son una familia que posee del prestigio y buena recomendación de toda su comunidad por haberse esforzado para poseer su propio negocio siendo fuente de inspiración para otras familia aledañas.
texts.en:
Señor Alvaro Jose P. V. is 32 years old and married. His wife works as a cashier and they have 2 underage children. With the support and effort of his wife, they set up a small store where they sell groceries, dairy products and personal and household items. He is requesting a loan for his business so he can increase his product inventory. This will allow him to increase his sales and thereby improve the household finances with new projects and new sources of income for the continued well-being of his family. This is his first loan with Kiva. They are a prestigious family that comes highly recommended by their whole community because they have worked hard to own their own business. They are a source of inspiration for other families in their community.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his store

loans.name: Julieth Cecilia

texts.es:
Julieth Cecilia L. es una joven mujer  que tiene 27 años y vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de Barranquilla, donde realiza apoyada por su madre una serie de actividades que le producen dinero como son  la confección de uniformes,  venta de carnes frías como salchichas y también comercializa mercancías entre sabanas, ropa, calzado, cosmético estos últimos a crédito, mientras trabaja como empleada ejerciendo la actividad técnica que aprendió en la universidad.

Vive con su cónyuge y su único hijo de 5 años  a quien desea enseñarle los valores con los que sus padres la educaron: la estabilidad familiar, el amor al trabajo y la responsabilidad, con la que parametriza su vida;  se inició trabajando desde muy joven y estudió a su vez técnica en sistemas de información; y fue  precisamente desde la universidad donde inició su negocio comercializando productos, como sabanas, toallas, accesorios femeninos entre sus compañeros de  estudio y con la ayuda de su madre; Al terminar sus estudios empezó a trabajar en una empresa privada donde encuentró oportunidades de aumentar su clientela  de mercancía y simultáneamente se inició en la confección de uniformes, realizando negociaciones que le permiten adicionar un nuevo ingreso, porque aunque no es ella la que realiza las operaciones de la confección,  en la actualidad gestiona contratos con organizaciones educativas y le paga la mano de obra  a una señora  que trabaja en la máquina de Julieth en su casa con la supervisión de su madre. 

Este es su tercer crédito con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la  ha apoyado en el desarrollo de su creatividad emprendedora, porque teniendo esos recursos de crédito  siempre  está pensando en oportunidades de negocios para invertirle un capital que aumente sus ingresos, otro de los aspectos que ha mejorado es que con sus ingresos, procedentes del negocio, ha podido pagar los estudios de su hijo en un colegio bilingüe y además ha comprado de contado a un mejor precio, para vender estas mercancias a un precio competitivo.
