Como negociante aun se encuentra perfeccionando sus posibilidades, mientras también trabaja como empleada desde que salio de la universidad y  todo esto para ofrecerle un futuro mejor a su familia. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva que lo invertirá en  la compra de telas con las que responderá a contratos con un colegio y mercancías varias como ropa, toallas, accesorios y calzados.
texts.en:
Julieth Cecilia L. is a young woman who is 27 years of age and lives in the April 7th neighborhood of Barranquilla. She and her mother engage in a series of income-generating activities such as making uniforms, selling fried meats such as “salchichas” (sausages), and selling merchandise on credit such as bed linens, clothing, shoes, and the latest cosmetics. Julieth also works as an employee at a job where she exercises the technical skills she learned while attending university.

She lives with her husband and five year old son. Julieth wants to teach her child the values that defined her life and were instilled in her by her parents such as family stability, love of work, and responsibility. She began working at a young age while studying for her technical degree in information systems. It was while she was at university that she began her business selling products such as bed linens, towels, and women’s accessories to her classmates with the help of her mother. Upon finishing her degree, she began working at a private company where she found opportunities to increase her customer base for selling merchandise. At the same time, she became involved in producing uniforms. Since she was not directly responsible for the sewing, Julieth began initiating negotiations to create new sources of income and now has contracts with educational organizations. A woman uses the machine in Julieth’s home to do all the sewing under the supervision of her mother.

This is her third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has supported the development of her entrepreneurial creativity. These available credit resources have provided her with opportunities to invest in her businesses and have the capital to increase her earnings. Another aspect that has improved is her income since she can pay for her son’s studies at a bilingual school. In addition, she is able to make business purchases in cash so that she can get a better price, which makes her more competitive when selling her products.

As a businesswoman, she is still refining her abilities while working at the job she obtained upon finishing university. She does all this so that she can provide a better future for her family. At the moment, Julieth is requesting a Kiva loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics so that she can fulfill her school contracts. She will also buy different types of merchandise such as clothing, towels, accessories, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for her sewing business & merchandise to sell through her retail business

loans.name: Ali Voya

texts.en:
Ali Voya is a 25-year-old resident of Likoni who supplies foodstuffs to shops and food kiosks to earn his living. Being married, he has three children.

Ali Voya has been in the business for one year and now he is taking a second loan from KADET to boost his stock of foodstuff for his supplies. Having his business located in places like Likoni, Mtongwe, Kona Mbaya, Bubu, around homesteads and by the roadside, he hopes to have more sales and succeed in life through his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of foodstuffs for his supplies

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: HACIENDA CHACRASANA

En esta Alcancia conforman 08 microempresarios, todos ellos se dedican al comercio; se esfuerzan por mejorar día a día su negocio,  aumentar sus ventas, y proveerles el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Tal es el caso siguiente:  
 
HayD. Rosario con 40 años D. edad, conviviente y con un hijo, hace 07 años atrás aperturó su negocio en su vivienda, HayD. empezó con la venta D. salchipapas, y hoy en la actualidad complementa su negocio con la venta D. gas, recargas virtuales D. celulares Claro y Movistar, como también el servicio D. llamadas al paso, gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo ella ha  logrado contribuir en los estudios D. su hijo quien ahora se está preparando para  postular a la universidad.
Si ella contara con un capital D. dinero, terminaría D. construir su casa y adquirir un puesto comercial para su negocio, 
Ahora con el reciente préstamo que le otorgó EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD  lo invertirá para incrementar su capital D. negocio, en la compra D. mercaderías, balones D. gas (contenido) para así mejorar su nivel D. ingreso y proporcionarles el mejor servicio a sus clientes Los gastos D. su hogar lo comparte con su conviviente Luis Enrique Luque Farfán, HayD. se siente muy feliz por tener el apoyo D. EDAPROSPO como intermediario financiero y economico.
texts.en:
Name of the group: Hacienda Charasana This community group is maD. up of 8 members. All of the members are business people. They work on their business day after day, increasing their sales, and striving to proviD. better service to their clients, as in the following case: HayD. Rosario is 40 years old and she lives with her partner and their son. Seven years ago she remodeled a section of her home to set up a business. HayD. started selling salchipapas (a national dish consisting of sausages, chicken, and potatoes). She has expanded her business to also incluD. the sale of propane gas, prepaid cell phone cards of Claro and Movistar brands, and public telephone services. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to contribute to the education of her son, who is now preparing to start university. If she is able to have a sum of capital funds she will finish building her house and set up a dedicated location for her business. The loan she has requested from Edaprospo-Prosperidad (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to supplement her capital funds, and she will purchase merchandise and gas tanks, to improve the income earn through her business. She will proviD. her clients with better service and she will be able to cover the household expenses. She shares the responsibility with her partner Luis Enrique Luque Farfan. HayD. is very happy to have the support of Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their businesses.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 34 años y su pequeña hija Rosali, con quien posa alegremente en la foto. Desde muy pequeña, Mercedes aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y ahora tiene sus propios sembríos, en los cuales cultiva papa, choclo y arvejas, los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus campos, ya que así tendrá productos para vender dentro de 6 meses, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su producción. Con el tiempo, desea poner un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se está vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 34, is a simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Hector, 34 and their little daughter, Rosali, who is shown in a happy pose in the photo. From the time she was very young, Mercedes learned to work with the land, since farming has been in her family for many years. She learned how from her parents and now she has her own plantings where she grows potatoes, corn and beans that she sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she likes most about her work is planting the fields since this will produce sales within 6 months. She has been doing this work for 11 years and what she finds the most difficult is the infestation of insects that can hurt her production. With time she would like to put up a stand to sell in the wholesale market in Tarma so that she can improve her earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She feels that the support will be beneficial and that way little by little she can improve her life. In her communal bank she is a very reliable member and she is always careful with the payments. With the one thousand five hundred new sols that she is requesting, she will buy seeds for the beans since this plant is a legume and sells very well in these months.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for beans

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza T. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Liza is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Liza operates a retail store where she sells products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, noodles and canned goods in the local community. Liza is just starting this business.

In 2007, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be Liza's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business by purchasing additional goods.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bessy Roxana

texts.es:
la sra. Bessy Roxana M. G. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama y caballero, tambien trabaja como Impulsadora en una fabrica.
sus clientes son empleados de la fabrica y otras personas que les vende sus productos los fines de semana, su mercaderia la vende al credito, en estos momentos tiene un pedido grande de ropa interior y se esta preparando para la epoca navideña.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bessy Roxana Mejía Gómez, 29, lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood and sells ladies and men’s underwear.  She also works as Sales Agent for a factory.

Her customers are employees of the factory and other people she sells to on weekends.  She sells her merchandise on credit and right now she has a large order to underwear and she’s preparing for the Christmas season.

She will use the loan to buy underwear.  She needs the profits to cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy underwear for women and men.

loans.name: Pilo

texts.es: El señor Pilo G.  cuenta con su negocio de comida denominado “Tortas Max” en que ofrece los siguientes platillos: hamburguesas, tortas y gorditas de diferentes guisos, los cuales ofrece a un bajo precio de acuerdo a la economía de sus clientes. Con esta actividad  tiene dos años la cual es su  fuente ingreso extra ya que el trabaja en un centro comercial de guardia y su esposa operadora en una maquiladora. Esta familia desea prosperar pero sobre todo ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Señor Pilo G. has a food business called “Torta Max” that offers the following dishes:  hamburgers, cakes and gorditas (biscuits stuffed with different stews).  He offers these at low prices to accommodate his customers’ income.  

He has had this business for two years.  It is a source of extra income since he works in a shopping center as a security guard, and his wife is employed in a manquiladora (foreign-owned assembly plant).  This family wants to prosper but, above all, offer their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; tiene 30 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tiende de abarrotes y también se dedica a la venta de jugos en el mercado de Ollantaytambo, ella tiene un pequeño puesto y por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the community bank "La Union de Ollantaytambo", which is located is the Ollantaytambo district in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Dina is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She balances her daily activities with running a general store.  She also works selling juices in the market in Ollantaytambo, where she has a small stall.  Thanks to these businesses, she hopes for her children to get ahead.  

She would like to expand her general store.  She is asking for this loan to purchase items like rice, sugar, milk, and oil at wholesale prices.

Dina is thankful for the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil at wholesale prices

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Francisco; el tiene 64 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es agricultor de profesión él se dedica al cultivo de flores,siendo esta su principal actividad, para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes que se encuentran en Cusco y también en Urubamba.
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio y también para su uso personal.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Llankachiapac” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Francisco is 64 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a farmer who raises flowers and delivers them to his customers in Cusco and Urbamba.  He is asking for this loan in order to invest into his business and also for personal expenses.

He appreciates those who have helped make this dream possible through this means and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 29 years old and single. Currently, he sells a variety of items in his shop such as cooking oil, sweets, soaps and sandals. He wants to add a line of clothes to his shop with the loan he has requested. The profits arising from this loan will strengthen his business and help him grow his boutique.

Jean dreams of buying a motor vehicle in the future to help his business activities in terms of transportation.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Analiza's Group

texts.en:
Analiza A. is from the village of Buena Suerte, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Analiza is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Analiza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Analiza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Analiza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios M., 51 years old, is married to a farmer. She has five beautiful daughters and one son. Remedios helps her husband maintain their farm. She also helps in selling their harvest to people in their community. Remedios also finds time to grow pigs in their backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. Remedios wishes for her family to have better living conditions.

Remedios is in need of additional piglets, feed and seeds. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and piglets

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in the business of selling oil. She is 36 years old and single. She borrowed a loan to stock more ice cream to sell. In the future, Joice hopes to expand her business with extra profits.

loans.use: stock more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Sigrid

texts.en:
Sigrid lives in the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a general store and earns about PHP 3,000 a month from her work. 

Sigrid joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 14,900 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a small general store

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. is into the production and sale of "Fante kenkey" atTakoradi. Efua has received senior high education. She is divorced and has five children. With this burden of taking care of five children at hand, Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family. She has been in this trade for six years. She plans to reinvest her additional income for further growth.

loans.use: Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives with his family of eight, all adults, in his home village of Kisii in South Rift, Kenya. He has spent much of his life in farming and has two farmhands who help with the daily farming activities. He produces tea, bananas, peas and maize, which he delivers to the local market for sale. He gets pension benefits for additional income.  

Francis has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that a dairy cow acquired with the loan will improve his income and make their living standards better, especially with healthy nutrition from the consumption.

Francis points to inadequate capital and animal diseases as the main problems in farming in his area.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: El Jocotal Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Jocotal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son María Lucrecia O. Urbina, Neli Susana S. y Lila Lastenia G. Cano originario de Diría municipio de Masaya.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Lucrecia O. quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y ropa desde hace varios años. Ella inicio vendiendo cosméticos Avon y luego fue creciendo su negocio.
Actualmente O. con el crédito invertirá en mercadería de temporada es decir a provechar la semana santa.
Las otras integrantes Lila Lastenia G. tiene una comideria en la que invertirá el crédito y Neli Susana S. tiene una panadería y con el crédito comprará materia prima.
texts.en:
The group named "Jocotal" is made up of three hard working, enterprising individuals who expend their efforts. They are Maria Lucrecia O. Urbina, Neli Susana S., and Lila Lastenia G. Cano. They are originally from the Diria municipality in Masaya. 

The coordinator of the group is Maria Lucrecia O. and she has had a business selling cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing for many years. She started out selling Avon brand cosmetics and with time she expanded her business. She will invest her loan in the purchase of seasonal merchandise in order to take advantage of Holy Week. 

As for the other members of the group, Lila Lastenia G. and she has a restaurant in which she will invest her loan, and Neli Susana S. who has a bakery and with her loan she will purchase ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a 30-year-old member of Yie group in Faulu Kenya. He runs a salon and a barber shop so as to earn a living. He has been running the business for six years with three employees. Being a married man with two children, he works hard in his business so that he can provide for his family. He hopes to expand his business in five years. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more chairs and shaving machines.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and shaving machines

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline M. is 33 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 7 years. 

She sells various item such as lotion, soap, sugar, rice, etc in her boutique. Her business is well-organized. Joseline has three year's experience in her business and she works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via vision finance company in order to purchase more items such as lotion, soap, sugar, biscuits, eggs, etc., to sell. With any profit, Joseline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more items such as lotion, soap and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Rosario Edith

texts.es: El mayor  sueño  de  la Sra. Edith es  acondicionar  su casa, en  este  momento  comenta  que  esta  realizando  la construcción  de  un  cuarto , del  cual ahun le   falta la  losa,   la cual  no  a podido  terminar  debido  a  que   no cuenta   con el  presupuesto  necesario  porque  se   han presentado  otros pagos   inmediatos  e  indispensables  como  los  gastos  de  graduación de  su   hija, agradece   el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto  porque   podrá  ofrecer a   su  familiares  y  amigos  una  mayor  comodidad  cuando  la visiten.
texts.en: Edith's greatest dream is to improve her house. She comments that she is building a new room but it is still missing a floor. She has not been able to finish it because she doesn't have the necessary funds. She has incurred other immediate and indispensable expenses, such as her daughter's graduation expenses. She is thankful for the support granted for the completion of her project. She will be able to offer her family and friends a greater level of comfort when they visit her.

loans.use: to build a new room in her house.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Ellen works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing and personal collections business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ellen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her business.

Ellen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Devine Touch Group

texts.en:
Hellen (the lady with the black scarf) is 52 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with five children, with one attending school. She also cares for three dependents.

Hellen runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 20 years. She says the main challenge faced is late payments from clients. Hellen has requested a loan of $250 to buy more t-shirts, blouses and warm-type clothing for winter.

She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family’s quality of life. In the future, Hellen plans to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Sansar Area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older son is a student while the younger two are pupils. He manages a photo studio with the help of his wife at a rented apartment. He started his business in 2008. Before starting this business, he sold construction materials for 5 years. He now conducts a Canon service business in addition to photography services. He is a polite man who says, "I want to expand my business in order to earn more money so I can pay tuition fees of my children." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a heater for his house, which is a he build by himself.

loans.use: To purchase a heater

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a single parent taking care of six children. She sells provisions such as toffee, milo, powdered milk and other items at Elmina, which she has done for six years. She wants to sell more types of provisions and will use this loan from Kiva to buy these. Her future plan for the business is to open another branch in a different village.

loans.use: to buy other varieties of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Fernando Augusto

texts.es: Fernando vive en el barrio Carrizal de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí tiene una tienda, donde vende al detalle, ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, enlatados y refrescos y otros alimentos que consumen las familias en su dieta diaria. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa a quienes les vende de contado y maneja también algunos créditos, que recupera semanalmente. Fernando es un buen padre de familia que vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 5 años. Su experiencia en esta actividad es muy tradicional en su familia, pues desde los 8 años, cuando llegó a la costa caribe, su padre fue su ejemplo en esta actividad comercial y esta es la experiencia que lo llevó a emprender su propio negocio, para de manera independiente tener oportunidades de ingresos;  aunque también trabajó en la construcción, posteriormente y con el producto de su trabajo disciplinado y el apoyo del concuñado quien le facilitó de manera incondicional el poder adquirir mediante plazos su tienda, con la cual  inició su aventura de negocio,   generado ingresos y se siente muy entusiasmado en hacerla crecer.  Su meta más adelante es construir una segunda planta para adecuar su vivienda en ese espacio y  aumentar el bienestar de su familia . En la actualidad Fernando está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, conel cual comprará viveres, abarrotes, enlatados en mayor cantidad, con los cual aumentará su capital de trabajo y mantendria un stock de los productos que rotan rapidamente y que muchas veces sus clientes no encuentran.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in the neighborhood of Carrizal in the city of Barranquilla. There he has a retail store where he sells snacks, groceries, canned goods, soft drinks, and other foods that families consume as part of their daily diet. His main customers are housewives who pay with cash, but some will ask for credit and then repay on a weekly basis. Fernando is a good father. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 1 and 5. His experience in running this business is a family tradition. When Fernando was 8 years old, his family arrived from the Caribbean coast. His father was his example and the inspiration that led him to start his own business, work independently, and create opportunities to earn an income. Fernando previously worked in construction, which provided him the discipline needed to run a business. With the unconditional support of his wife, he was able to acquire the means to open his store. By starting this business, Fernando now has a source of income and is very excited about being able to grow. His goal moving forward is to build a second floor to his home so that he can have more space to provide for the well-being of his family.

At the moment, Fernando is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy food, groceries, and canned goods in large quantities. This will increase his operating capital and help him maintain an inventory of products that have quick turnover. Often times, his customers are not able to find these products.

loans.use: to purchase food, groceries, and canned goods in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shirts, ties and blouses

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 51 years old and a resident of Liwayway Diffun Quirino. She is married and has been blessed with four children. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Esmeralda operates a variety store, where she sells different kinds of groceries in small quantities to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Esmeralda makes a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by pieces. Her store is located in front of her house. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan which will be used to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, sugar, shampoo and junk foods for her retail shop. She is hoping that she can maintain her business so that she can support her youngest daughter for whom she spends her income for daily allowances and school fees.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, sugar, shampoo and junk foods for her retail shop.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en: Erik is engaged in beekeeping. He would like to increase the number of beehives and develop his business further. With the requested loan Erik plans to purchase beehives. Development of beekeeping will help Erik increase his income and insure a better life for his parents and his future family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Madame Marieme est une jeune  femme mariée de 21 ans. Elle gère  un local dans un marché de la localité ou elle vit. Elle évolue dans le secteur de la restauration et vend petit déjeuner, déjeuner et diner. Parallèlement  elle commercialise des habits unisexe qu’elle place a ses clients. Elle a choisi son activité de commerce dans le souci de ne pas rester dépendante, mais aussi par amour du métier. Le moment le plus favorables a son activité est  la période  d’été ou son activité lui génère  le maximum de bénéfices.Elle est membre d'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC depuis 11 ans .  Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires qui lui permettent  de cuisiner les plats qu’elle sert dans son restaurant. L’augmentation de ses revenus l’aide à couvrir ses dépenses personnelles et a assurer les frais de scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en:
Marieme is a young, married woman of 21 years. She is active in the catering industry and runs a restaurant in her local market, where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She also markets and sells unisex clothes to her customers. She started in this line of work to ensure her financial independence, and because of her affinity for retail. She does the most business during the summer months. 
Marieme has been a member of a UIMCEC branch for 11 years and is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs to buy the ingredients needed for the meals she serves in her restaurant. She will use her increased income to cover her personal expenses and the educational expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for the meals she prepares in her restaurant.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui vend des pneus depuis 2008.Il a démarré son activité avec un financement de 500000F de l'UIMCEC.Son Son activité lui permet d'aider sa famille notamment ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et soeurs.Il sollicite un nouveau pret à l'UIMCEC de 500000f pour acheter 90 pneux.Son ambition est d'installer dans sa localité une grande société de vente de pneux.
texts.en: The borrower is a young bachelor who has been selling tyres since 2008.He started up his business with a loan of 500000F from UIMCEC. His activity enables him to help his family, in particular his parents as well as his brothers and sisters. He requests a new loan of 500000F from the UIMEC for the purchase of 90 tyres. His ambition is to set up  a big tyre selling company in his town.

loans.use: buy 90 tyres.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a divorced woman with five children in school. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mlongo has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its convenient terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. Her children are aged between 14 and 26. Herminia’s husband is a fisherman.

Herminia is engaged in seaweed farming. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. Herminia works hard to help support her family. She requested a loan to purchase materials for seaweed farming such as wooden pegs and straw.

loans.use: to purchase materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a hardworking businesswoman and she is single. 

For the last year, she has been selling shoes and handbags to make a living. She also practices tea farming to supplement her income. She has employed two people to assist her to manage the business. 

Rael has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 

In the next five years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy shoes and handbags for resale. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Génesis” lo conforman 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de ropa, comida preparada, preparación de pan amasado y repuestos de vehículos. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de La Serena.
Carol delegada D. grupo D. Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila y está ubicada en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Su cabello es corto y su color es castaño oscuro, viste jeans y una polera estampada. Ella se dedica al rubro D. comercio desde hace siete años. Específicamente vende artículos de paquetería, bazar y ropa. 
Sus productos los vende puerta a puerta y en ferias libres.
Comenta que se ha capacitado en micro emprendimiento y caja bancaria. Con esto ha aprendido diversas estrategias para organizar su negocio. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará poleras y juguetes, especialmente para la temporada de navidad. 
Las metas en su negocio son instalarse en un local establecido y habilitarlo al interior de su casa, para esto se encuentra ahorrando para construir el espacio físico de su local.
Carol vive junto a sus tres hijos de 19, 17 y 11 años de edad. Comenta que su hijo mayor estudia en la Universidad la carrera de ingeniería en computación informática. El sueño de Carol es que sus hijos sean profesionales y en futuro puedan crear una empresa familiar. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además disfruta de las reuniones realizadas con los demás emprendedores y comenta que son muy responsables. 
La Serena es una ciudad al norte de Chile, ubicada en la  Región de Coquimbo, provincia de Elqui. 
Es un importante sitio turístico, especialmente durante el verano, donde la gente va a visitar sus playas. La ciudad se dedica principalmente al sector de los servicios, habiendo varios bancos e instituciones financieras y una variada oferta gastronómica y hotelera. En las últimas décadas, el turismo se ha convertido en unas de las actividades económicas más importantes, además la ciudad es paso obligatorio de cientos de cruceros que arriban a la ciudad de Coquimbo, en donde en La Serena encuentran el lugar de residencia provisoria para visitar la zona y el V. de Elqui.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Genesis" and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in various professions including clothing sales, food preparation,  baking homemade bread, and spare parts for cars.  They all live in the city of La Serena.  

Carol is the director of the communal bank and appears in the front row in the photo and is the first person from right to left.  She has short, dark brown hair and is wearing jeans and a printed shirt.  She has been a merchant for seven years.  She sells packaging materials, trinkets and clothing.  She sells her produts door to door and in the open air markets.  She says that she has been trained in micro business and finances.  She has learned diverse strategies for organizing her business.  She buys her merchandise from distributors in the city of Santiago.  With the loan she will buy t-shirts and toys, especially for the Christmas season.  Her goals are to set up an established locale for her business and to furnish the interior of her house.  She is saving for the construction of her locale. 

Carol lives with her three children ages, 19, 17 and 11.  She says that her oldest son studies at the university, majoring in computer engineering.  Carol's dream is that her children become professionals and in the future, are able start a family business.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  In addition, she enjoys the meetings with the other entrepreneurs and says they are very responsible.  

La Serena is a city in the northern part of Chile, located in the Coquimbo region in the province of Elqui.  It is an important tourist site, especially during the summer when people visit the beaches.  The city is primarily dedicated to the service industry as they have various banks and financial institutions and they offer diverse cuisine and hotel accommodations.  In the last few decades, tourism has become one of the most important economic activities.  In addition, the city is a mandatory stop for hundreds of cruise ships that arrive in the city of Coquimbo where La Serena is the temporary residence for visiting the area and the Elqui Valley.

loans.use: purchase t-shirts and toys, especially for the holiday season.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila nació en la ciudad de Urubamba pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella tiene 74 años y es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. 

Petronila desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Petronila requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Petronila se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Petronila pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Petronila was born in Urubamba but currently lives in Ollantaytambo.  She’s 74 years old and is a hardworking enterprising woman.

Petronila works in Ollantaytambo, selling food from her small store, located in her home.  She’s been doing this for several years and things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work.

He needs this loan in order to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, cooking oil, and other things.

Petronila is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and she promises to make her payments on time.  She’s a member of the Señor de Choquekillca” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a 40-year-old food kiosk owner in Barsheba, Mombasa.  She is a married mother of nine children, who has been in business for the last ten years and is doing great. 

Mishi was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. She plans to renovate her food kiosk and purchase more maize flour for her stock.   She will use the anticipated profit to expand her kiosk further to enable her to accommodate more clients.   She hopes to prosper and have a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: renovate her food kiosk and purchase more maize flour

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 31-year-old business lady who deals with the sale of clothes, handbags and shoes in Mombasa town. She is single and has been running this business for the past two years, and she is doing great in the business. 

She was introduced to KADET by another client and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more stock of handbags, shoes and clothes so as to cash in during the Christmas festive season. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and hopes to realize more profits and be stable in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of handbags, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Sakina Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sakina bibi is 40-years-old and a married lady. She lives with her husband and four children who are 20, 16, 14 and 12 years old.  Her elder son has completed his education till 10th standard and now works as a salesman in a grocery store earning monthly wages. The child next to him in age works in a factory.  

Her husband is taking care to stock his small grocery store. This is the business which makes him the income. He has been operating his grocery store for over 8 years.  

Sakina is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With this loan, he will buy stocks of soap, sugar, coffee, oil, rice, and candies for his grocery store. This will help him make more sales and thereby improve his family's conditions. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina bibi”.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Homer Francisco

texts.es: Homer  Francisco es un emprendedor que lucha día  a día por buscar la comida diaria de su familia proporcionándole los necesario, el ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000,  ha mostrado ser un emprendedor con metas en la vida y en negocio en crecer cada día, nos expresa que gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado ha aumentado su inventario en el negocio y de igual manera sus clientes . Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería en general  para brindarles a sus clientes una variedad de los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Homer  Francisco is an entrepreneur who strives day by day to feed his family, and provide them with the basic necessities. He has already had credit with Fundación Leon 2000, and has shown himself to be an entrepreneur with goals in life, in business, and in growing each day. 

He says that thanks to the support that he has been provided, he has increased the inventory of his business, and also his clientele. 

Currently, he is applying for a loan to invest in his business through the purchase of merchandise in general, so that he can offer his customers a variety of the products he sells.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in general.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un homme de 21 ans et sans enfants qui vit chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, dès son jeune âge il suivait les animaux c’est à dire l’activité de berger auprès de son père au village.
Quelles années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village pour Bougouni afin d’apprendre le commerce notamment l’achat vente des articles de boutique auprès de son frère.
 Avec 5 année d’expérience, il maîtrise cette activité. Après avoir correctement remboursé, son premier prêt , il est à son deuxième prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs du sucre, 5 cartons de thé, 5 cartons de cigarettes et 3 cartons de savons pour sa boutique.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, monsieur Yaya compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage toujours agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Yaya is a 21-year-old man. He has no children, and he lives with his father in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni. He did not attend school, but rather, from a very young age, helped his father look after animals (shepherding) in the village where they used to live.

Some years later, he decided to leave the village and move to Bougouni in order to learn about the business of sales, in particular buying and selling goods in a shop, from his brother. With five years of experience, he has an excellent command of this business. After having properly paid back his first loan, he is asking for a second loan in order to buy three bags of sugar, five boxes of tea, five boxes of cigarettes, and three boxes of soap for his shop. He buys his supplies in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His customers are typically locals.

With this loan, Yaya expects to achieve monthly profits of 35,000 FCFA. With the profits, he still plans to enlarge his shop.

loans.use: to buy various items for his shop

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 47-year-old married woman.  She is a mother of 2 children and she lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Khalwa wants to take out a loan of 500 JOD so that she can buy inventory home furnishings. In the future she want to open a store in her home.

loans.use: to buy inventory home furnishings

loans.name: Sana'

texts.en: Sana' is 38 years old; she lives in Ramallah with her family. She started her beauty salon business and within a year she was working at another salon as an employee. Therefore, she has good experience in her field. Sana' asked Ryada for this loan to buy a hair dryer and a device for cleaning facial skin, which will make her salon different from others and attract customers. This will also improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation. Her dream is to expand her business. She is very grateful to everyone.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a device for cleaning facial skin.

loans.name: Delma Aracely

texts.en:
My name is Delma S. and I make slipcovers for car seats, which I have been doing for 3 years, my clientel is very good because many people use slipcovers to protect their seats. My business allows me to generate enough to cover household expenses and my goal is to be able to sell more and with the earnings, buy myself another sewing machine and to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase of fabric, thread and plastics.

Mi nombre es Delma S., me dedico a producir cobertores para asientos de carros, actividad que hago en mi negocio desde hace 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena porque bastante gente les instala cobertores a los carros para proteger los asientos, mi negocio me genera para cubrir los gastos de mi casa, mi meta es lograr vender mas, y con las ganacias poder comprarme otra maquina de costurar y sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de tela, hilo, plastico

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir is 34 and he is the resident of Beylagan town. He has his own booth where he sells parfumery products. He runs this business since 2005. His first loan was in amount of $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch. His next loan was in amount of $600. Now he needs $1000 to increase the variety of goods and increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband (who appears in the photo) and their 5 children.  She works selling groceries and earns $4/day, while her husband earns the same selling groceries at a different location.  One of their children helps out by contributing the wages they earn at the garment factory.  Nhan S. will use this loan to buy more grocery items so that her family can increase their income.  In the future, she would like to send all of her children to university.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

texts.en: Mrs. V. and her husband are both 58 years old. They have 3 children; two are already married and her youngest son, 27, is single and lives at her house. They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. She grows vegetables in the fields and also buys vegetables from others to sell at her shop. Besides the vegetables, she also sells duck and pig meat at her shop. A few years ago she switched her rice paddy into a fishing pond because of the higher profit. With selling vegetables she makes $62.50 per month and the fish give her an additional $50 each month. To help her son, she wants to borrow money so he can open a restaurant next door. She also wants to build a bathroom next to her house.

loans.use: She wants to buy inventory for a new restaurant and also wants to fix her bathroom

loans.name: Chork

texts.en:
Chork married in 1992 and has 4 children, one son and 3 daughters. He has been in business driving a remork (motor taxi with a carriage at the back) since 2005. He brings workers in the village to the garment factory site in Kandal Steung district. His wife and 2 daughters are garment factory workers in Kandal Steung district.

Chork is asking to borrow $500 from MAXIMA as a first loan, in order to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi. With his remork, he can generate more income to support the family and feels sure he will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing a new carriage for his motor taxi

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet O. is a 42 year old woman, married with 7 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions, rice and fish to people living in her community. She is hard working; her determination and discipline has enabled her to always repay her loan on time every week.  Juliet is requesting a loan of $325 to buy more provisions, foodstuff and fish.  She has been in this business since 1989 and has been in LAPO for the past 4 years

loans.use: To buy more provisions, food and fish

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen S., 45, is a mother of three children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she not only works as a broker, buying yam and rice crops from the growers and selling them for a profit, but also works selling fruits at her house, earning collectively around $4/day in revenue. Her husband is meanwhile employed by a local organization, earning on average about $2/day. Mrs Sen S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more yam and rice crops to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more yam and rice crops to reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita is a humble mother who, with a lot of hard work and diligence, has achieved the progress of her business and has also been able to send her four children through higher education. They support her unconditionally in her work.

In spite of her advanced age, this hard-working mother does not know weariness, and that’s why she wants to continue prospering in her business sewing and selling fleece clothing. To obtain this goal, she works with the same eagerness and dedication as when she began the business more than ten years ago.

Margarita’s wish is to transform her small shop in one of largest in the city. Achieving this goal requires an increase in her investment capital for her business and she turns to your kind heart to acquire more raw materials (fleece fabrics). With this she can continue to create a wide variety of styles of jackets.

This hard-working mother awaits your prompt response.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Margarita, es una humilde madre que con mucho esfuerzo y diligencia ha conseguido el progreso de su negocio y ha otorgado también estudios superiores a sus cuatro hijos, quienes la apoyan incondicionalmente en su oficio.

Pese a su avanzada edad, esta laboriosa madre no conoce de cansancio, es por eso que sigue deseosa de seguir prosperando en su labor de confección y venta de prendas de vestir a base de tela polar. Para conseguir este objetivo trabaja con el mismo ahínco y dedicación con el que emprendió este negocio hace más de diez años.

El deseo de Margarita, es convertir su pequeño taller en uno de los más grandes de su ciudad. Para lograrlo requiere aumentar el capital de inversión de su negocio y recurre a tu gentil corazón para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima ( tela polar) y así seguir confeccionando gran variedad y modelos de buzos.

Esta laboriosa madre espera por tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantity and variety of basic material

loans.name: Atabek

texts.ru:
Atabek N. is 53 years old, has finished high school, is married and has seven children. Atabek owns a small plot of land on which he is planning to raise wheat. He is planning to use the loan to purchases wheat seeds. This loan will help him buy what seeds, plant his plot and harvest the grain, which he will mill into flour and bake bread for his own use. Flour sold in stores is much more expensive then the flour he will be able to make himself. This wheat harvest will be enough for him and his family for the next year. Atabek is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Нурмахмадов Атабек, возраст – 53 года, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 7-х детей.Атабек имеет небольшой участок земли, на которм он хочет посадить пшеницу. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение семян пшеницы. Кредит поможет ему закупить семена пшеницы, засеять участок и получить урожай пшеницы, который он использует для переработки в муку и выпечку хлеба для личного потребления. Так как готовая мука в магазине стоит намного больше, чем та которая будет производится подобным образом. Собранный урожай хватит ему и его семье до следующего сезона. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of wheat seeds

loans.name: Ocheng D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Getrude N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Getrude is 41 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 7 to 15 and only one goes to school. Each week, Getrude makes approximately UGX 75000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide maximum health services to the family. Getrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 1000000 in order to add more clothes to the shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Getrude is joined in her small group by Berna N., Rose N., Sarah M., and Mastula N.. Berna N. has a beauty salon business and wants to purchase more braids, hair oils and chemicals. Rose N. is currently operating a piggery business and wants a loan to buy more piglets. Sarah M. operates a business selling fresh food and wants to boost business. Mastula N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more cloth material.

loans.use: To increase clothes business inventory

loans.name: Saasaai 1 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 12 women of Saasaai 1 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business's development and help each other guarantee on-time payments.

Tuliloaina May G. (36, married, 3 children): to grow taro, bananas and tuamu, she needs weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knife filings, 2 bush knives, fertilizer and laborers.

Legogo E. (20, married, no children): to start a cattle farm, 2 cows and 2 ropes.

Siiae V. (58, married, 8 children): for her retail shop: canned herring, rice, milk, chicken, sugar, flour and noodles.

Sina S. (24, married, 2 children): to sell BBQ plates: boxes of chicken, soy sauce, onions, Chinese onions, bananas, plates and other items.

Sina E. (45, married, 5 children): to grow taro, bananas, tuamu and raise cows: 1 cow, 2 ropes, a knife, a knife filing, a spade and pesticides.

Aitasi S. (29, married): to sell pancakes: flour, oil, sugar, soda, baking powder and a fryer.

Vaaipu Sageli T. (39, married, 4 children): to grow taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knives, 2 filings and 5 laborers.

Faisealofa F. (50, married, 5 children): to grow taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a filing, a knife and boots.

Ivapene S. (43, married, 7 children): to sell BBQ plates: wires, 2 pots, a box of chicken, sausages, tomato sauce and other ingredients.

Eseta F. (51, married, 7 children): to sell taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, knife filing and 2,000 taro roots.

Sina F. (28, married) to sell taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knives, a filing, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and an axe.

Leone F. (55, married, 7 children) to sell cabbages, beans, cucumbers, etc.: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, filing, axe and 2 spades.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 10 and 7 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 15, 10 and 7 years old. Zaina sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 3am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Comité San Rafael Group

texts.en:
This Comite San Rafael group of women was formed in October 2006. Maria Teresa Franco and Juliana V. initiated the first meeting and convinced 16 ladies to work together to form the group in order to have access to capital. Excited about the idea, the ladies decided to form a committee in order to bring prosperity to their families.

The ladies are involved in many business activities such as: running grocery stores and selling fruit, clothes, bags, shoes, drinks and sheets among others. The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase these goods.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

loans.use: The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase fruits, clothes, bags, shoes, drinks and sheets.

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous K., age 50, is married and lives with six of her children. She and her husband have a business selling fish in a busy market, earning around $5 profit per day. They are supported by two of their children who work in a garment factory, each earning $120 per month. To facilitate greater access to transportation, they would like to request a loan to help purchase a motorbike. They believe this will reduce the cost that the family spends on motor-taxi to transport fish to the market. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Rous was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel N. was born in 1960 is not married. He has three children. Samuel is requesting a loan of $250 with which he intends to buy poultry, sprayers, seedlings, and medicine. He is convinced this activity will succeed because he will take care of his animals and crops, and the urban population and his local town will provide a ready market for his eggs, chicken and vegetables. His business will help the community by providing, among other things, spices and tomatoes, which are staples for people in his area. 

With the profit realized from this activity, Samuel intends to eat well, live in a better house, increase the size of his farm and provide himself and his family with medication in times of ill health. He has borrowed and repaid GHAPE loans six times without any problems. He is requesting a loan from GHAPE because training is offered on income generating activities and GHAPE charges a lower interest rate than he would be offered elsewhere.

loans.use: Poultry and gardening

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina is a member of the La Familia (The Family) Communal Bank, situated in Jr. Comandante Barrera #130 in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 30 years of age and is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a motor cart driver. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, Karina decided to invest in the sale of beauty products.

Karina is a hard-working woman who, one way or another, looks for financial betterment along with her husband. She generates income through several activities such as the sale of cheese, which she goes out to sell every morning in her neighborhood. She also sells beauty products and rents out a sound system.

With this loan of S/ 1,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase an amplifier for the sound system and more cheese.

Karina is very happy for the support she receives from Manuela Ramos, being that thanks to it, she has been able to achieve a certain financial stability that she very much hoped to offer her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Barrera # 130, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Karina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de productos de belleza.

Karina es una mujer muy luchadora que de alguna manera busca su mejora económica junto a su esposo tal es así que cuenta con una serie de ingresos como venta de queso que todas las mañanas sale a venderlos por su barrio, también vende productos de belleza y alquiler de equipo de sonido.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará un equipo amplificador de sonido, compra de queso.

Karina, esta muy contenta, por el respaldado que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ello ha podido superar ciertas estabilidad económica que tanto anhelaba para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase an amplifier for the sound system and more cheese.

loans.name: Advija

texts.en:
Advija A. is a 41-year-old women. She lives in a village named Donja Orahovica near Gračanica. Advija is divorced and she has a 13-year-old daughter.

Advija and her daughter have good organized lives. Her daughter goes to primary school and Advija is employed in an ambulance. She has a good salary from her work in the ambulance and her work at home. She has an accounting service but she is not satisfied with her equipment for that service. That is is the reason why she wants to take a loan through WWI in the amount of 700 KM. In this way she will be able to offer better service and get more clients. She hopes that she will make give good service and that her daughter will maybe work together with her.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her accounting service
